Reviews.Title: “First time at Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: shivergirl
Reviews.Content: We've been to LV several times, but this was the first time at the Suncoast. This hotel was part of a training program, and so we decided to go a few days early and stay here too. The room was large, great for an extended stay. Our room overlooked the pool area and the golf course. Exceptional views. The casino was large and has a big selection of table games as well as slots/video poker. There are several restraurants to choose from, as well as coffee shops, ice cream parlors, and casual dining. There is a bowling alley and movie theatre accessible without going outside. The parking garage is very convenient and when the temperature is over 100, the car in the shade is a good thing. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and the little gift shop makes things handy. The only minus I have for the whole week we were there is there is there is not any live keno. We love to take a break from the tables or poker, and relax with a slow paced keno game and a beverage. Otherwise the trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great price in massive hotel and casino toward the west side”
Reviews.Author: Greybutstillgoing
Reviews.Content: Got a great internet price for a huge room with a refrigerator. Ground floor is mostly casino with some eateries. Convenient to Red Rock Canyon. Our bonanza was finding a Tropical Smoothy shop a few miles away with the best fruit smoothies anywhere and wholesome sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 3 day Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyFelder
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many times but this is our stay off the strip. Wife is getting tired of the sleaze and the drunk 20 somethings in all of the casinos. We have enjoyed our stay at other Boyd's casinos so we thought we would give the Suncoast a try. We were not disappointed!! Check in was a breeze and the room was large with a beautiful view of the golf course. ( all I did was ask for it ). I laugh at all of the reviews about too much smoke, ITS A CASINO PEOPLE!! If you don't like smoke do not stay at a casino hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor and we had no problems at all, and we are non smokers. We tried everything this hotel has to offer and we were not once disappointed. The area of Summerlin is very nice and when we ventured down to the strip the drive was 10 minutes. This will be our 1st location of choice for our next visit into Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: James V
Reviews.Content: The family comes to Summerlin every year and stays at the Suncoast. Here are the +'s: great golf location (5 courses within a few miles), very reasonable rates, excellent suites for families (large one bedroom or two bedroom suites with living room), movie theatre and bowling on premises, nice restaurant options, great views from floor to ceiling windows on golf course side, close to red rock for hiking, close to great restaurants across street in Summerlin, enough slots and gambiling tables to keep you happy, and a gorgeous Marriott Resort with Casino next door. Here are the -'s: pillows, sheets, blankets are very cheap (definetely not a "Heavenly Bed"), Casino is filled with smokers and older locals....tough on the eyes both ways. We have been coming for years, so I would recommend it. If you are looking for a bit more up scale, the Marriott and Red Rock Casino-Hotel are great steps up for a price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Danie'l S
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for a little Easter get away. The property was clean and nice. The pool was a little small but very nice. We ate a TGI Friday's and had breakfast at the buffet. Both places had good food and service. The only bad experience we had was with a very rude front desk agent. But we won't let one bad apple ruin our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, nice view, good value.”
Reviews.Author: slipshaft
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the strip or downtown, this hotel is not for you. If you want to play golf, gamble, and get a break from the crowds, this hotel is definitely for you. Generally an older clientele, more civilized, not as flashy as your standard vegas hotel. Parking is plentiful, not too hard to get to the rooms. The rooms are clean, very large, and if they put you in the back you have a nice view of the pool area and golf course. A balcony/terrace off the room would be nice, but for what I paid I felt I got a really good deal. The Casino and elevators smell kind of smoky, but smoking and casinos are like peanut butter and Jelly!! The pool and hot tub are really nice and the 24-hour fitness center does the trick. I really liked staying here. Rooms are VERY clean. Nice TV, safe, and fridge also. No microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best Hotel in all Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Bigredmachine
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay over the weekend and am happy to report the hotel is still the best in town. Very clean, large rooms, attentive staff, great food at SC Steakhouse, great parking, lots of activities. What more do you want? To top it off, they also upgraded our room again. Of course, the best part is they are far away from the sleze of the "strip". A Players card is a must have!

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Hotel makes you want to leave the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dena H
Reviews.Content: Last weekend a bunch of my friends were getting together for March Madness and one of them that had been traveling for business recommended the Suncoast Hotel and Casino. When I first looked it up I was worried about how far from the Vegas Strip it was but when I got there, I was more than happy. The grounds were great, the food was wonderful, and the rooms were very very nice. The casino was of course really fun and I am told it is where the "locals go" so there were plenty of really nice and helpful folks around if you were looking for conversation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wanted to experience fun, gambling, and time away with friends. I give this hotel a VERY GOOD!! (the only reason I am not giving it a 5 excellent is because the shuttle to the airport only goes every 2 hours and that annoyed me a bit.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and value-priced hotel but far away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: moviemom88
Reviews.Content: My family lives in Summerlin, so we stayed here for a wedding instead of the Strip. This hotel is a great bargain and much less than what you would pay on the Strip. If your purpose is to gamble, swim and not venture out of the hotel, this is a good place to stay. The rooms are clean, like any decent chain hotel (Marriotts, Holiday Inn, etc), the restaurants are good and the slot machines are identical. There are definitely a lot of smokers here but the hotel rooms were recently renovated. It is across the street from a large shopping mall too. They run a shuttle to the strip and the airport but you'd probably be better off renting a car. If you purpose is to climb or hike in Red Rocks this is a good location. However...if you want to eat on the Strip or see a show there you are going to need to leave an hour before, not only due to the driving distance, but because of the bad traffic on Las Vegas Blvd (the strip). At these prices it is not reasonable to expect the same level of service as a five-star hotel. Also they do charge extra fees for other amenities but again, consider what you are paying as a baseline. I was happy with my stay, and my extended family was pleased too..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsToAll
Reviews.Content: Wonderful find! West of the strip but worth the trip! Very clean and rooms are amazingly beautiful. They also offer a shuttle service to and from the airport. Pool was in on the north side of the building so in the shade most of the day but still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: IIB
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino was ok. If you don't t like smoke not good. You have to walk through casino to eat or get to rooms. Good size rooms with refridgerator. We were given handicapped room (not needed) and floor got wet with every shower. Good front desk and bell service. Always ready to help. Buffet was included with room ok but same food everyday. No laundry services.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Irene E
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on the Internet and got a great rate. The room was gorgeous! The housekeeping was great, and the amenities were as well. Downstairs in the casino there was good choice as to where to eat. Interaction with casino staff was very friendly and helpful. This is a North Las Vegas location, and was perfect for us because we were visiting relatives who live in that part of town. I hope we can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Also Not a Happy Guest!”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltravel16
Reviews.Content: This place is NOTHING like the pictures online. It is tired and so is the staff. Not please that I pre-paid for a double room thirty days in advance and when we arrived they were sold out of two bed options. Nothing like the dinging of the elevator in a roll away bed to make it a wonderful vacation. There was NO APOLOGY. Our meals were not good. I would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Resort”
Reviews.Author: ritasmom
Reviews.Content: This Resort is Awsome everything one could need all in one place. stayed here over Superbowl weekend loved it. This was our second stay here, and i'm sure more will follow. Staff & Resort get 5 Star from me. Way to go Suncoast keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Easygoing”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMaven
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Suncoast in early February. The in-laws retired to Summerlin, and we visit them at least once a year. While I've stayed here in the past, it's been several years. Have to say I really like how laid back this place is. Easy to get to from the airport - about a 20 minute drive. The basic room was huge, clean and quiet. Some of the furniture was a little dinged up, but the bed was comfortable. Excellent in-room coffee.That's all I really need. Assets: room was clean, quiet, spacious. Buffet was cheap, especially if you joined the Emerald Club, and the food was good. Not spectacular, not fancy, but good. Staff were friendly. Exercise room was well-equipped. Parking was easy. Near many strip malls with lots of decent shopping options for the locals. Short drive to Red Rock Canyon, a must-visit spot every time we're there. Many options for entertainment besides gambling, including a movie theater, bowling alley and swimming pool (closed in the Winter). Deficits: shortage of garbage cans in the room. No soap dish - why do so many places neglect this simple item? No make-up mirror. Big empty space just inside the room entry that seemed to be lacking a piece of furniture for keys, purses, etc. - but the space was bare. The television reception was awful, and the channel selection was slim. Hallway carpets were in desperate need of deep cleaning or replacing. Not glamorous, but serviceable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Joanne8290
Reviews.Content: The room was a King, and was clean;as well as beautiful. I would say the carpet a littel outdated but overall nice place. I stayed there because it was close to my parents home, and they both were very ill. The location allowed me to spend my days with them and be back to my room in the evening. This was my second stay there and again not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average is the correct term!”
Reviews.Author: minimikey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the beginning of January- have stayed here before- the rooms are clean- if you get a view of the golf course its lovely, however the "specials" are always a view of the roof of the casino! Food is "average"- there are a couple nice places to dine but a bit pricey for Vegas. I guess my biggest complaint is that the staff and hotel workers really act like they could care less whether you are a guest or not. My guess is they make their money on the casino not the hotel- certainly if you don't want to stay on the strip this is a decent alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KonaRod
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Suncoast on a recent loop trip from SoCal. The room was very spacious and well furnished. We did get a bit of a musty smell every time we walked into the room - not sure what that was all about. If you want internet, you also have to pay. The best part of the stay was how quiet the rooms are-we did not hear a single person banging their way down the hall at 4 am coming back from the casino! The hotel offers lots of restaurant options and nice shopping near by. It is a bit of a drive if you want to hang out on the strip. However, for a more low key and quiet hotel/gambling experience, would highly recommend the Suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “Large, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: 4 Joyful Travel
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Orleans, but we decided to try a night at the Suncoast instead. We were pleasantly surprised. Check-in was fast and easy, and we got a $10 gambling credit. The room was quite large with pleasant decor, and it was very clean. We had a flatscreen TV, a desk, a table with 4 chairs, and one comfortable lounging chair with a footrest. Lighting was fairly good, with a couple bright reading lamps. We had a sweeping view from the strip to the mountains. We were pleased to have a mini-fridge (without freezer). Temperature control in the room was efficient and quiet. The large bathroom had two sinks and lots of counter space. Lighting in the bathroom was very good. The toilet and shower were in a separate room. The showerhead was good and there was plenty of hot water, but the thin towels smelled of smoke. We had a lunch and a breakfast at the buffet, and they were pretty average--not great--and did not have the selection that the Orleans has. However, the Suncoast is much smaller than the Orleans, so it does not seem so crowded. The room price is higher at the Suncoast. We would stay here again if we could get a competitive price, since the room itself was better than the Orleans rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: alanc72
Reviews.Content: Well off the strip, but excellent rooms and good value. The property offers free shuttles to the strip if you don't want to drive yourself, so the distance is really no inconvenience. The room was stunning, with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the golf course. Other than the smoke in the casino (which you have to go through) we couldn't fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Annie S
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the suburbs this trip to get a different perspective on Las Vegas and were at the Suncoast for 8 nights. We booked two rooms and although we had booked them months in advance, we were unable to secure two rooms side by side. The rooms were excellent, in true Vegas fashion, there was plenty of room, the bathroom was large and unlike other hotels we had stayed in on our trip, you did not have to climb over or squeeze past the toilet to get into the shower. The water pressure and shower heads were brilliant and the hand basin area was also very spacious, plenty of room for two people to work at the same time. The beds were huge and the linen was crisp and clean, there was a table and chairs, plus a lounge chair and desk, plenty of space for two people for an extended period of time. Our rooms had a view overlooking one of the local golf courses - it was awesome!!! The rooms were well serviced each day. The buffet meals were excellent and good value for dollar, we ate here regularly during our stay. We had our own vehicle so transport was not an issue, however there is a bus service that runs from the hotel into town and back. We taxied it back to the hotel one night and the fee was about $50.00 including tip which we thought was more than reasonable. The only minor complaint we had was the huge fans out of the back of the hotel which were quite noisy, along with the trucks backing into the loading docks during the night which were also quite noisy. Yes, we would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends, however we would request a quieter room, especially for such a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Bait and Switch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zippydc
Reviews.Content: Their sign as you drive up says "Rooms starting at $38" . When I went to check in the cheapest room was twice that. When I asked what happened to the $38 rate I was told that the sing says "starting at". So how many rooms did you sell at the $38 rate? I asked. "None". That is just dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Update”
Reviews.Author: kcm53
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas 4-6 times a year and usually stay at the Suncoast for part of our visit. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. -and quiet! We just returned from a 4 night stay over the holidays. Although there were no problems with the hotel room we did not gamble much at the casino because of the HEAVY SMOKE. We noticed this on our last visit but thought it may be a mechanical issue but that does not seem to be the case. We have been staying there for past 4 yrs and noticed the smoke is really getting bad. You are hit with a rancid cigarette odor at the door- not a great welcome! Suncoast mgmt please take note and update your system!! The hotel is only a short drive from Red Rock Casino and that is where we spent most of our casino time.

Reviews.Title: “Golfers delight”
Reviews.Author: Gatehouse51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights played 4 rounds of golf at Angel Park, Badlands, Arroyo & Red Rock all fabulos & close. The rooms in the resort are very cheap and huge with great views ovewr golf coarse. Great facilities. Cinema, bowling ally & great resturants. the Italian was the best ever a bit pricey but well worth it. The resort caters for all ages. Friendly staff, and breakfast buffet reasonably priced. Pool a bit small, inside casino is very smoky but for valve for money highly recommend. Great Golf shop close by called Galaxy Golf great for all golfing equipment, loved it. Approx 12kms from strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great "off-the-Strip" hotel”
Reviews.Author: alepore
Reviews.Content: I had a job in Vegas and stayed in this hotel for two weeks. If you are going to get a rental car while in Vegas, this is a great location/hotel. The major road it is on has a ton of restaurants and stores we are all used to with the prices we are used to paying (as opposed to the $5 water bottles on the Strip). The room was very clean and had a 42" flat screen with quite a few HD channels. My only complaint would be the buffet and the diner food in the casino was not very good. The Steakhouse, Mexican restaurant and the NY Deli was very good. The casino also includes a movie theater and a 24 hour bowling alley. I did not go to the movies but I believe they had 10+ movies to choose from. The bowling alley was standard size (or even on the larger size) actually holding a bowling league one night. As far as the casino goes, I loved it because I am not a "high roller" so I enjoy the $5 tables being available all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms...but look out for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: dman58
Reviews.Content: PROS: Rooms big, great, clean, quiet,etc. Big bathroom. Great price $59. Huge LCD TV CONS: - Smokey smokey casino ugh. If I get cancer I'm suing. - They have hidden charges $5 for casino fee (for frig, safe, parking??? total BS), $13 for wifi, - Beds a little hard and hard pillows, not a big deal - TV reception and choices are limited and lame, I guess they want you gambling -

Reviews.Title: “I come to Vegas often”
Reviews.Author: Caryb1440
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is part of a chain of hotels in Vegas. We stayed in a suite room which was clean but had damage furniture. The S C Steak house was good and service was good. But the casino is an ashtray. 10 minutes in the casino is like smoking a packs of cigarettes. The dealer was complaining and have cancer from being in this hotel for a day and half.

Reviews.Title: “Good off strip Las Vegas hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: Webhoncho
Reviews.Content: In Las Vegas over Thanksgiving holiday and stayed at the Suncoast from Thanksgiving day to Sunday. The hotel is closer to Summerlin than the Las Vegas strip. For some reason, my GPS wanted to direct me through downtown Vegas and the Strip on I-15 instead of taking I-215 west on the beltway around Vegas. If you drive to this hotel from the airport, stay on I-215 and do not bother driving on city streets until you get close to Summerlin, no matter what your GPS tells you! The hotel is a fairly nice, typical hotel and casino combination. I'm a non-smoker and had no problems with room or upper floors, but you will get the same second-hand smoke you can expect anywhere in Vegas near gamblers. But the air inside our room was fresh - no problems. Room was reasonably clean and well-maintained. I like the amenities in the hotel including several restaurants, buffet, snack bars, bowling alley and movie theatre. Distance to the strip is really not that far - consider that you are 20-30 minutes from the Strip by car in good traffic. There are supermarkets, restaurants, malls nearby. Lots of parking both outdoor and in. All in all, a decent experience and I would stay here again if I had a need to be in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “1 day get away”
Reviews.Author: Cody50
Reviews.Content: NICE Big room, clean** far from strip** large casino,

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at suncoast again. If you are visiting or local this casino does not represent vegas. Worst casino i've stayed”
Reviews.Author: piscorpleo
Reviews.Content: Lose money. Poor entertainment. Better off going to red rock. Don't let the low rates fool you. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPaul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended an event at this hotel and decided to stay the night. As this hotel is about 10 miles from the strip in Vegas, we weren't expecting anything special. We were pleasantly surprised, the room was spacious and clean, the hotel although small in comparison with the major Vegas hotels was still well appointed. I would happily stay here again, apart from the fact it is too far from the strip otherwise it is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Book yourself a top suite - exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra561
Reviews.Content: Only 10 minutes from the Las Vegas Strip (to the West), in the beautiful new "planned" town of Summerlin, Nevada, sits a wonderful resort property, the Suncoast Hotel and Casino. The "regular rooms" are more than 400 square feet and are so inexpensive as to make one wonder about this hotel. However, let me tell you that it is the cleanest property in Las Vegas, partly because it is a smaller property, and the cleaning can be done properly! Be sure to book a room or suite overlooking the golf course. This hotel sits at the foot of the Red Rock Mountains, so the views are spectacular. As with bosox3100, we discovered Suncoast around 8 years ago, when our friend Phyllis Diller did her "goodbye stand-up comedy show" there. We go to Las Vegas at least 3 to 4 times a year, and ever since finding this gem, we would never stay anywhere else. Yes, you need a car - there is a a shuttle both to the airport and the strip, but you will want a car to come and go as you please. The entire 10th floor has all suites - 1, 2 and even 3 bedroom suites. Even the 1 bedroom suites are at least 800 square feet; have a full bar with refrigerator; dining room table that sits 8 people; large living room; enormous bedroom, and the biggest bathroom you will ever find in a hotel - all marble - Roman tub - walk in shower (which is so big 8 people could fit in it) and the toilet is compartmented so that you can be in the bathtub or shower and still use the facilities in the suite. Frankly, you don't ever have to leave this hotel - there is an 18 theatre complex inside the hotel; there is a huge bowling alley (which you never hear!) on the second floor; parking is complimentary; there is golf; a swimming pool, great gambling; several restaurants, including an excellent steak house on the top floor; an Italian gem on the casino floor; the requisite buffet (which is excellent, by the way); a cafe; a small restaurant with ice cream and goodies; even a TGI Friday's. It is also across the street from a new Cheesecake Factory and lovely shops. One block away is a great restaurant called "Mimi's". This is where all the local "talent" live. It is an elegant community, and great to be away from the craziness of the strip, yet close enough to go down every night for a show. Love, love, love this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: BcCanadaCateyes
Reviews.Content: My husband was there for a seminar in November/2011 for 6 nights so I went along with him. The hotel is great nice and clean and not to far from the strip about 20 min ride so a car rental is best. It can get smokey on the casino floor when its busy, so we went with a non smoking floor and a golf view so pretty. The rooms are comfortable with big bathrooms and good showers always had hot water. Housekeeping services were great we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Love Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: bosox3100
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to LV(2X year) for 18 years. We have stayed any several of the newer, popular hotels on the strip. However, approximately eight years ago, we discovered Suncoast and haven't stayed anywhere else since! It is truly a value. Although, about 18 minutes from the strip, it lacks for nothing, a true resort but in an affluent neighborhood, only five minutes from Red Rock Canyon. It has five restaurants(all very nice), beauty salon, lovely pool, exercise facilities, sauna, casino, shuttle bus(to the airport & strip), daily USA today, showroom, lounge acts. The views are incredible, rooms very large with sofa, double sinks, two phones, WiFi access, large flat screen TV but the best part is the view from the floor to ceiling window which spans almost the entire wall! The hotel is immaculate, beautiful carpeting in rooms, bathroom is exceptionally large with vanity, double sink, granite counters, two phones, slate floor and tub area There is also a coffee maker, coffee in room, large armoire, sofa, coffee table . It is actually more like a suite because the room is OVER 800 sq feet with a half wall and columns separating the bedroom and sitting are. One side of the hotel overlooks the lovely golf course. Actually, the hotel is surrounded by three golf coursers. Prices are incredible, staff and clientele wonderful Prices are incredible. It is also very quiet in th hotel area

Reviews.Title: “Functionally excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a week stay at the Suncoast for business. The customer I was visiting is located in West LV, so the Suncoast's rates mid-week were fair enough to stay there. For those unaware, the Suncoast is a locals all-inclusive resort hotel/casino at the corner of Rampart and Alta in the fabulous neighborhood of Summerlin, NV. It is practically next door to the Rampart/Casino-JW Marriot and a short drive to the Red Rock Station. The areas surrounding the Suncoast are nothing less than upscale, clean, and very appealing. Just 5 minutes from the hotel on W. Charleston blvd are a Target, PF Chang, Gordon Biersch, Whole Foods, and various other retail outlets and restaurants. I hope to one day live in Summerlin or a neighborhood with its qualities. Anyway, I don't like writing reviews that reiterate what others have said, so I'll add in some bits of information that would be beneficial to anyone visiting the Suncoast in the future. I arrived to LV on a Sunday night, grabbed my rental car, and headed directly to the hotel. Upon arrival, I found that parking was available either at the surface level or in the garage. A previous review here mentioned that the 4th floor of the parking garage is usually empty, and this was the case. Why does this matter? You can park very close to the entry to the elevators, which means less distance to haul your luggage. I was able to get a spot up front all five days I stayed at the Suncoast. I suppose this would be less desirable during the summer, though, as you will be parking your car 4 floors closer to the sun than ground level. The walk from the parking garage to the casino is maybe 3-5 minutes as you have to take an elevator in the parking garage down to the base level, then take a short walk along the "upstairs level" to the escalators that lead to the casino near the poker room. The walk here is maybe 75 meters, and there is a moving walkway to use, if needed. When at the casino level, hotel registration will be on the right side of the main casino floor area, past the table games. As I arrived on a Sunday night, I was the only one in line to check in and the service was excellent. You might as well sign up for the Boyd Gaming "B-Connected" card while you check-in because it offers some worthwhile discounts. You will receive a small card with details on all the discounts you get at the Suncoast with this players club card. I was booked in a 9th floor room overlooking the golf course. The room itself was fairly large with a wall-mounted flat screen TV (no HD programming, unfortunately), a college dorm refrigerator that seemed to have trouble keeping temperature, and beds that could have used nicer sheets -- they felt a bit scratchy but were comfortable once you settled in. The bathroom was not bad, as it had a sliding door to partition the toilet and bathtub from the dual vanities. The room did include a clothes iron, but it was tethered to the ironing board to deter theft; frankly I can't understand what type of person steals clothes irons from hotel rooms. There is also a medium sized safe that I used to hold my laptop and other items while out on the town. To summarize, the rooms at the Suncoast are standard fare for Vegas plus a few extras (in-room refrigerator, large windows, central heating/cooling). After I got settled into the room, I headed out to the main casino to grab dinner and entertainment. Being a sucker for seafood, I visited the Oyster Bar and had a half dozen oysters and a pan-roast type dish with fish in a tomato based soup. The food and the service were excellent and I didn't have to wait for seating. After dinner I walked around a bit to get a feeling for the layout of the casino, which consists mostly of newer slot machines and various video poker and keno machines. You can always recognize a locals casino for having mostly VP/Keno machines. The table game activity seemed a bit dull, though. I headed up to the 2nd floor where the bowling alley is located. This is where the B-Connected card came in handy as it offers a buy one, get one free game of bowling, which, combined with the Sunday night special of $1 games, got me 2 games of bowling plus a pair of shoes for under $4. The bowling alley is quite nice and is a great way to pass some time while having fun. During the week I visited the different stores within the casino and had no complaints. The TGIF restaurant was quite good, and the little ice cream shop next to the coffee place has a great selection of sweets. Wrapping up the week, I noticed that the Suncoast has a generous check out time of 12 noon, which allows you to sleep in if you're visiting for personal leisure. I didn't charge anything to my room, so I was able to check out over phone on the morning of departure. Now, to justify the title for this review, I am in my mid 20s and I just felt like the vibe at the Suncoast was about 3 decades beyond my age. Most of the casino patrons appeared to be retired, so I wasn't expecting it to be like Planet Hollywood, but things just seemed dull most of the time. Even for business travel, one of the big reasons I enjoy Vegas is the energy in the air, and this was seriously lacking at the Suncoast. The accommodations were perfectly fine and the service was excellent, but it lacked the "oomph" that would have brought me back in the future. Would I return to the Suncoast? Only if the rates were very low. Otherwise, I can think of a few other places on the west side that have more energy.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcmBoston
Reviews.Content: I stay at Suncoast every time I go to Vegas. I have family close-by, making it very convenient.. One side of the hotel overlooks a beautiful golf course, the other side offers views of the strip in the distance. They offer free valet parking as well :). The buffet is affordable, as is the bagel shop. They also have a 75 cent hot dog cart at lunchtime near the sports book.. Free shuttles to the strip too! Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped-off in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: Not as good a deal as it appears to be. From the hotel's website, I couldn't tell that the free airport shuttle only runs between business hours -- as I arrived later, I had to spring for a cab which almost doubled the price of my stay (it's about ten miles from the airport). In addition to the room rate, they charge a "resort fee" ($ 5 per night), which gets you a cup of coffee in your room (which elsewhere is usually free), a copy of USA Today, and -- you guessed it -- a shuttle to the airport, if your flight comes in or leaves during business hours.For that amount, I could have booked a hotel right on the strip. For good measure, they botched the wake-up call I requested, and I almost missed my connection. A complaint with the management predictably led to nothing but the offer of a another, complimentary night at their establishment. No, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “They look after us here.”
Reviews.Author: dusty1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights in a 1 bedroom suite with golf course view.

Reviews.Title: “Senior Special”
Reviews.Author: llsee
Reviews.Content: If Las Vegas is not your destination, but a stopover, finding a reasonably priced hotel room can be frustrating. Fortunately, the Suncoast filled my needs. We were traveling through Vegas on our way to Fallon, NV, and needed to stay overnight in Vegas. Since we were heading north on US 95, I looked for a hotel on the north side of town and not too far off the highway. I wanted to avoid the traffic and hustle of the strip. The Suncoast has been around for a few years, but it has aged well. The rooms are very spacious, and my wife and I appreciated the double sinks in the bathroom. We stayed here a couple of years ago, and it has not changed much, except the hotel seems to cater to a much older crowd now than I remembered. Most everyone was in the over 50 crowd (myself included). The casino was pretty standard for Vegas. It seems to me that in this day of computerized gaming, casinos have pretty much lost their personality, and one vegas casino is pretty much like any other. I am not a gambler, but the regulars said that the slots at the Suncoast were exceptionally 'tight'. The hotel has about 5 restaurants clustered in one corner of the hotel (obviously sharing a kitchen), along with the usual coffee shop, Buffet and a TGI Fridays. We ate at the Italian themed restaurant. The food was decent, a cut above the big Italian chains, but the wine list was pricey. I enjoyed watching our waiter flirt with all of the older ladies in the restaurant. I'm sure he does well on his tips.

Reviews.Title: “A gem away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: joee5
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise to both me and my family. When I first booked this trip my wife was leary of what to expect for such a cheap rate but upon our arrival we were alll shocked as to the cleanliness, modern rooms, freindly staff, lose slots, great housekeeping, excellent and efficient Sunday Brunch, swimming area and lastly the awesome and expedicious valet parking team. I would definately recommend this hotel to any and all of my friends. My hats off to the valet parking crew. Due to the fact that I had a rental car for our week long stay in Las Vegas, I used the valet parking 2-3 times daily. Each and every time we waited 2 minutes TOPS before we were seated in our vehicle enroute to our destination. This really is a beautiful hotel and the beds are so comfortable. The only bad experience we had was on 3 consecutive days I had to complain to the front desk about a chain smoker near the elevators on the 3rd floor. (The 3rd floor is a non smoking floor and the smoke was annoying my daughters allergies). The front desks response to my 3rd and final complaint was that "some people are hard headed." Whatever that meant but that was the only flaw during our entire weeks stay. Only complaint, no WiFi unless you pay 12.95 per day. Give us the WiFi for free like other hotel chains do on the east coast. Dont nickel and dime your future tourists. Stayed from October 11 to October 18, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Ended here by accident - pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: code3md
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business, and didn't even know this section of town existed. The hotel was not glamorous, but certainly was comfortable. I had my doubts at check-in as the young lady was less than user friendly, but everything else went fine. The casino was very smoke-filled - I personally never found a smoke free area. The biggest plus was the surrounding area with wonderful restaurants, and everything else you could possibly want - I for one, opted for the massage.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bed was a bit hard. We had a wonderful picture window view of the golf course and Las Vegas! The staff was friendly. We had a difficult time figuring out where to park to check in. All the parking spaces were taken for self parking. So we parked in the valet parking and went in. I'm glad we used the valet parking. It was much easier getting in and out and they were quick to bring the car. The restaurants was good. I didn't like the $5.00 resort fee. The price at $117 and $67 for the 2 nights we stayed was reasonable. I think they should have one price instead of add ons. We wanted wi-fi but the price was $12.99 per day! Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: gbjames
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is a great choice for a Vegas stay, especially if you want relative peace and quiet at times. The drawback is the distance from the strip - you definitely need a car and some planning skills. The pool is small but not crowded. The gambling is better than on the strip, especially the pay tables on lower stakes video poker machines. Nothing fancy about the dining or lodging, but if you want a comfortable place to stay without breaking the bank, Suncoast is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: NateAshworth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Suncoast for four day due to a business engagement nearby. I must say that I very much enjoyed my stay. The rooms & hotel overall were nice & clean. Everything was well kept & the service overall was excellent! If you are okay with staying off the strip & taking the free shuttles to/from the strip & airport, you absolutely cannot beat this place. Everything you need & want is in the Suncoast - but if you just HAVE to go to the strip you are able free of charge. I am quite positive I will find myself at the Suncoast again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back, but Suncoast, please nix the floral smell in the casino!”
Reviews.Author: Solaradna
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here this past week and was very pleased with just about everything. My room was very spacious and clean with a fantastic view of the strip from the 7th floor, Wall to wall, floor to ceiling window, refrigerator, safe, couch, plenty of electrical outlets, large bathroom, and USA Today complimentary at my door every morning. Staff and casino dealers were all friendly. My ONLY complaint is the odor in the casino, and I'm not talking about smoke. It is some floral smell they must put in the ventilation system...it really reeks...I could even smell it in the parking lot before walking thru the doors! I would almost prefer to smell smoke...it smells like a bathroom freshener. It worked out with me, I did most of my gambling at the Red Rock, which is only about 3-5 minutes away, and gambled just a little at Suncoast before retiring to my room at night. Definitely will be back, but I hope before I am, they get rid of that awful floral stench in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good value away from the glitz”
Reviews.Author: DavenCarol
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Suncoast about eight times in the past five years while visiting relatives in Summerlin area. When we started staying there the rooms were $39 & $49 depending on whether you overlook the casino roof and a view of downtown or overlook the neighboring golf course and the mountains and the J. W. Marriott resort. Depending on the day and time of year the prices are still about the same with regular specials. They do add on a $5 "resort fee" for local calls, newspaper at the door etc. but you can decline it if you choose. The buffet breakfast has everything from soup to nuts including pickled herring and ice cream for $8.99 unless you sign up for the casino players card (no charge) then it is $6.99. They have several eating spots for everyones style or taste. We ate at the steak house this time and the food was very good however the portion size was way more than needed. The 10 ounce prime rib cut was more like 16-18 ounces and the mashed spuds came in their own bowl of about 3 cups. Enough for about 2-3 people but each of us got one. The rooms are spacious, I would guess about 300 sq ft, and clean. The bath is large and well lit with a two sink vanity. They have smoking and non smoking floors with the usual ice and vending by the elevators. They also have some suites but we have never stayed in them. A lot of the pictures that have been posted on Tripadvisor give you a good idea of what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Hotel & Casino is a great value in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: William J
Reviews.Content: I visited the Suncoast Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas last weekend and was pleasantly suprised. The rooms are clean and the rates are great! I live in Las Vegas for my second home, and many times I bring friends to gamble here in Las Vegas. They all can't stay at my home, so we usually look for a local hotel and casino to stay at that is affordable. The Suncoast had great restaurants, clean rooms and winning slot machines at a low price. The only drawback I had was that as a non-smoker, the casino needs better ventiliation. It was very smoky in the casino area. Highly recommended! William Mahoney

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: spiny84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Suncoast because I was attending a seminar there, so the hotel was really chosen for me. The rates were very reasononable and I wasn't sure what I'd get for the price, but I was pleasantly surprised. I stayed in a high standard, very generously sized and attractive room. Accommodation at Suncoast is exceptionally good value. The smokiness of the casino has been mentioned in many other reviews, and it was evident from my first moment at Suncoast, as the hotel reception desk is in the casino area. I stayed on a non-smoking floor, so my room was always a haven of smoke free air, but occasionally there was a smokey smell in the corridors of the 7th floor. Service at the hotel's various restaurants was always great. I had room service a couple of times, the menu choices were limited but adequate and service friendly and efficient. After 11 days at the hotel, I was a bit over the food and craved a simple piece of toast for breakfast, but for a shorter stay for if I had more time to go elsewhere for food, the hotel provides many options. Shopping nearby the hotel was at Boca Park (lots of restaurants there too- my seminar was too busy to allow time to try them. I did have a couple of outings to the Strip, catching the WAX bus, which leaves from the Suncoast car park, to the Premium Outlet North mall and then the tourists buses to the strip. I caught taxis back to the hotel both times, the fair is about $40 from the Strip to the hotel and $55 from the airport to the hotel. The hotel does have an airport shuttle that I used on the return journey. Overall, the Suncoast is excellent value for money if the location suits and you can stand the smoke in the casino, the accommodation is very comfortable and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “My only choice in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kristina11
Reviews.Content: I love the rooms. They are spacious and my favourite feature is the rooms facing the golf course and mountains. The windows are floor to ceiling, wall to wall. What a view! The beds are comfortable and the decor is restful. The hotel has everything you need - movie theatre, bowling, bingo, several restaurants, pool and hair salon. This year I have been rewarded for my loyalty, which is very much appreciated. Yes, it is a off the strip but it doesn't take long to drive there if you want to take in the sights or a show. A shuttle is provided, but I prefer the freedom of a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: snowbeltOH
Reviews.Content: We have made 4 trips to Suncoast in the last 6 months from Ohio. We were recommended here by a "local" friend of ours. I must say, we are "addicted" to this property. Being a frequent Vegas visitor for 25 years, I have never been to a nicer hotel/casino with a feeling of HOME. The rooms are always clean, comfortable beds, double bathroom sinks, powerful shower. The refrigerator and coffee maker are HUGE bonuses. We always request a Golf View room, and are extremely pleased with the view. We usually stay on the 8th floor (smoking floor).St. Tropez buffet is always very good. The point structure this property has for free meals is unparalleled. We just returned from a 4 day trip, and never paid for one meal. The crowd is more mature as noted in previous reviews, which is why I enjoy this property. We actually sleep at night, without the noise. We still have comp rooms at Harrahs and Station properties, but we will not use them anymore, as this is our new home. If you want the strip experience, stay on the strip. If you want a positive experience with friendly personnel, stay at Suncoast. Yes, all workers have bad days, but most personnel here were friendly. We have only had one negative experience with a BConnected girl at their desk. We have WON, and brought home more money in the last 3 trips here. Overall, and most important, we feel completely SAFE and comfortable here. Thanks Suncoast for a true vacation experience, everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ercuan
Reviews.Content: We have family in the Summerlin area, so we typically stay at the Suncoast -- far less expensive than the chains and much nicer! It's not near the Strip, but shuttles are available. The airport shuttle, sadly, doesn't run as early as I've needed in the past, but we usually rent a car anyway. The rooms are clean -- and I am very picky about room cleaning! -- and we've never had to wait for check in for more than a few minutes.The casino isn't huge, but there are plenty of machines and tables at a variety of $ minimums. Also close to great shopping, golf courses, and a large number of restaurants. If you are willing to stay off-Strip, it's a good option.

Reviews.Title: “clean, nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ariverbabe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The bed was very comfortable, we were tired and had been driving for a long time. We appreciated the nice view and the clean rooms..good price too

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinaj22
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel with everything you could ever imagine within, two floors of lively casino surrounded by a 16 screen cinema with all the latest films and a 20 lane bowling alley! Thats not forgetting the beautiful outdoor pool and jauzzi. There are bars everywhere and endless restaurants including the choice of 8 in 1 all you can eat and drink for around $10!!!! Everything you could want and great quality, rooms are just immense with perfect views of aurrounding death valley. Staff are excellent, polite and efficient, any issues and they will resolve them without fuss! Great entertainment in the theatre every day and night. One thing, if you come to vegas for the strip it is a bit of a journey, about 20 mins but easily accessable on the shuttle (however the last one back is at 10 and that is early for vegas)!!! But when you do get to the strip prices triple, food and alcohol etc so you save sooo much at suncoast and wont miss out on a thing!!! Just brilliant...

Reviews.Title: “Since they don't shuttle to strip and only transport to airport until 6pm, I wouldn't recommend w/o car.”
Reviews.Author: gspuyallup
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. Food was good. But compared to local casinos in our state, the pays were horrible. Getting around would be almost impossible w/o car.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for value”
Reviews.Author: woody1417
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly this time. I noticed the difference, except 1causasian female at the slot club. She was rude, but on the positive side, there was 1 African American was excellent and very friendly. The rest of the staff in the hotel was very friendly, including the maid. The buffet was good with good variety and nice deals if you play at the hotel. They do seem to be changing the poker machines with less pay out for the full house.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: swcjlc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast for 5 nights and enjoyed the multiple amenities there. They have several on-site restaurants and all the gambling activity you can handle. The rooms are spacious and generally well kept. Apparently the maid forgot to clean our room the last day of our stay(probably because we forgot to tip her the day before). I highly recommend a room on the golf course side of the building(odd number rooms). The view is amazing! Would have given 4 stars had they cleaned our room every day. Also, signing up for their player's card gets you food discounts and $10 free slot play(with $20 co-play).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Great Restaurants and Wonderful Casino”
Reviews.Author: golfkrazy2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live within 5 minutes of the Suncoast Hotel and Casino, so we have never taken advantage of the opportunity to stay there. However, we do spend a great deal of time in the Suncoast gambling and eating at their restaurants. All of the Suncoast's staff members, be it in the restaurants, slot areas, bartenders, cocktail waitresses or table games, are outstanding. They go out of their way to insure their guests have a positive experience. One of the previous reviewers said the Suncoast caters to the 55+ year old crowd, which I find humorous. Yes, I must admit that it does not have a "Hard Rock Hotel" clientele, but it is far from a geriatric retreat. The Suncoast is located 20 minutes from the strip and is an ideal location for anyone who wants to relax in Las Vegas, yet gamble, eat, and play golf.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: RPO1130
Reviews.Content: Got a really sweet deal on a room for 5 nights, so I wasn't expecting much. To my surprise, the room was very large, clean and comfortable. One whole wall was glass overlooking a golf course, so we could sit with our coffees in the morning and watch the golfers. The room had a refrigerator, but no microwave. The staff was pleasant and helpful. This facility is a good distance from the Strip, but for people who don't like the hustle and bustle (like me), it was perfect. Low minimums on the tables and penny slots made gambling affordable and fun. If you're looking for non-stop action, this isn't the place for you. But for families it's a great deal. One negative - the TV had very limited channel choices, but, hey, it's Vegas -- you're not supposed to be watching TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: gigdeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast from Tuesday, August 2nd through Saturday, August 6th. We were comped 4 nights in a golf course view room with $150 per day food credit and $150 per day slot credit. Needless to say, we did not even approach our food limit for the day, even though we ate each night at SC Prime Steakhouse - delicious by the way! Our room was spotless and the beds were comfortable (and I am pretty particular). The water pressure in the shower was good and the maid service was quick and efficient. Everyone with whom we interacted seemed like they actually enjoyed working for Boyd's Gaming, which was a nice touch. Our room had huge floor-to-ceiling windows which looked out onto the first hole of Angel Park mountain golf course - it was fun to watch the bunnies and birds in the early morning and just before dark when they're brave enough to wander out onto the fairways. We also feed chipmunks from our golf cart and saw a coyote. We also enjoyed watching the mowers out with their headlights on, mowing the fairways before sun up. There was no detectable odor of cigarette smoke in the casino, hallways or on our non-smoking floor. The carpets and furniture all appeared to be in very good shape and everything was clean and well attended to - no dish trays left in the hall, etc. Even though the temps were in the 105 - 108 range, we played golf two mornings next door at Angel Park. Their customer service is awesome - they pick you up right at the hotel and let us store our clubs their overnight. The shuttle bus driver told us that they have had to cut back on their shuttle service and no longer pick up or drop off at the Tropicana - they only go back and forth to the airport now. We had a delightful stay, never venturing away from the hotel on this trip. We are looking forward to our next trip, even though the gambling gods did not smile upon us this time. As a matter of fact, we never did see anyone receive a hand pay and there was no whooping and hollering from the craps or black jack tables. Well done, Suncoast!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: wedding0
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel with my 2 year old son we loved it we got married in las vegas ,,the staff was verry nice and always with a smile it was verry clean and the food was good even though we wear far from the strip ther was a bus coming every 1////2 to the hotel and it was free i will be deffo coming back to this hotel verry good and clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Didn't end up staying there, but received great service”
Reviews.Author: d0gsrule
Reviews.Content: I didn't end up staying at this hotel so I can't rate the accommodations, however I wanted to put in a good word for their customer service. I made a reservation on a Thursday night for Monday morning, then realized Friday morning that the hotel was quite far from where I was going to work. When I called to cancel, I expected to suffer some sort of deposit loss but instead was given a full refund (it was 72hrs in advance) by a very helpful, pleasant employee. She asked me to keep them in mind for next time, and because of that great service that she gave me, I will- and I'm making the effort to tell others to do so, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel at an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: JayhawkSteve59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Suncoast last weekend. We were visiting family in the Summerlin area. We selected a non-smoking room with a king sized bed, golf course view. We arrived mid morning and I called ahead to see if we could get into our room early. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and we were in our room by 10:30 AM. Our room was quite spacious, and very clean. Nice amenities included a safe and a refrigerator that cooled water well. Two extra, comfortable pillows were found in the closet. A lot of smaller hotels struggle to keep the smoke smell from the casino from coming up into the rooms. There was no hint of a smoky smell. I did not gamble, but the casino had adequate craps, roulette, blackjack, and Pai Gow tables. I did not eat at any of the restaurants, but they looked fine. Bowling and movie theaters are in house. The surrounding area is very nice- much like an upper middle class suburban area. Within 5-10 minutes, there are several nice restaurants and shopping. While there, I signed up for a free "B Connected" card. I got home, and needed to add a room for a December trip I have planned. The reservations people were very helpful in getting me a second room for half the cost I got on the website, and they reduced my existing room rate by 50%, too! I will use this hotel exclusively when I return to Vegas. You will not be disappointed in the Suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “CRAP, CRAP, CRAP”
Reviews.Author: mkaspar45
Reviews.Content: Dont wast your money or your time. From beginnig to end this was the single worst hotel out of the over 2,000 hotels I have visited in my lifetime. Details incluude leaving me strasded at the airport to a crap hotel room. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME IN VEGAS AT SUNCRAP! Lice and bedbugs in the room they assigned me..

Reviews.Title: “Best property in all Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Bigredmachine
Reviews.Content: Do youself a favor and get away from the sleeze of the strip and stay at the best hotel in town. Very clean, large rooms, attentive staff, good food, great parking, lots of activities. What more do you want? To top it off, they also upgraded our room. Don't forget to sign up for a Players card after you check in. Love it so much, going back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: 00_ArtySmarty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the Strip and located in the Summerlin area of Las Vegas. The facilities and furnishings are newer and the hotel has activities like casino, movie theatres, bowling alleys, pool/hot tub, and a sports book. We found the food to be very average. The upsides: We got an upgraded room because they were full--nice perk and the views were stunning. The room was very comfortable and spotless. The free parking lot is spacious. There are 24 hour eating options (good for when you take the red-eye in or out). There is a shuttle to the Strip area. The downsides: The casino area is smokier than other Vegas casinos, even with the air filters running. Pool bar not open in March. Servers were generally not very attentive and there were long waits at the front desk. Internet access was 14.99/day.

Reviews.Title: “We always love it and we always come back!”
Reviews.Author: andy22605
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Las Vegas to visit relatives three to four times a year for the past sixteen years. Whether from reservation desk to casino floor, bellhop to resturant, the staff at the Suncoast are always helpful, polite and observant to our needs. During our last visit, to surpirse my mother on Mother's Day, the reservation desk personnel were kind enough to accomodate my special needs and even upgraded our room at no extra charge. The the beds are comfortable, the rooms are big and always clean. If ever there is a problem, which rarely happens, it is attended to in a heartbeat with a smile and an apology for the inconvenience. Since the Suncoast Hotel first opened it has been our first choice as the place to stay when visiting our family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, but could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: peachmom13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Suncoast Hotel for a wedding we attended. This hotel was chosen by the couple, so we weren't sure what to expect. The staff was pleasant enough. Upon entering, we immediately noticed how strongly it smelled of smoke (much stronger than any other casino we've ever been in). Our room was spacious enough and clean, though dated somewhat in appearance. The toilet in our bathroom leaked a bit and the brass towel racks were all scratched up as well. The wallpaper was peeling off in a spot or two. Our toiletries were not replenished at all during our stay, but we didn't bother to call about it. The price of course is ridiculously low. My husband and I aren't big gamblers, so thought we would enjoy some time by the pool. We were surprised at how small the pool was and that there were no poolside servers. It is more like any backyard pool rather than a pool for a large casino. There is a TGI Fridays near the pool, which we were able to get drinks from and ate at a couple of times. The food and service there was very good. There is a bar by the pool, but it wasn't open at all during our 4 day stay. This property is a good 30 minute ride from the strip, which is about a $50 cab ride one way! For us personally, we would much prefer to stay closer in as we like to site see and visit different restaurants. The pool is also a large deciding factor for us as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Coolest place in Las Vegas...it's PERFECT!"”
Reviews.Author: Ronbee702
Reviews.Content: This week, we had friends in from Los Angeles for a two-day visit. We went everywhere...casinos, restaurants, the strip, antique stores, World Series of Poker, ...........tons of places. Our guests' FAVORITE stop.....The Artisan. The vibe was amazing...every staff member was enthusiastic and positive. The pool manager, J.R. was extremely hospitable and gave us a wonderful tour. The bartender...Lindsay... made us the most perfect drinks ever. (Our guest Mike said is was the BEST bloody mary he ever had) Chef Eric, as usual, worked his magic with a fantastic lunch. Even Odie the valet attendant was friendly and hospitable. Whenever we have friends or relatives visiting, the FIRST place on the agenda will be the Artisan. p.s. We did not stay overnight at the Artisan...it was strictly a luncheon/cocktail visit.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great food, our new favorite place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixdeb
Reviews.Content: we usually stay on strip for alll the action, but decided to try suncoast for a change and we are soooo glad we did as it is our new favorite place. parking is simple, well marked and easy to get from the garage to the casino via an indoor walkway. if you want to valet or need to pull up to the front door, that area is big and uncongested with lots of seating if you want to unload passengers and luggage. if you know vegas, thats a plus(!!!!) as most casinos are NOT easy to pull up to and even harder to find a place to park. we checked in early, not a problem....thats always a big plus with us....and the front desk was fast and courteous. first thing we noticed was how clean the casino, hallways and elevators were......never saw it any other way the whole time we were there. the rooms are very nice, big and clean. the bathrooms are HUGE, big shower space and lots of counter space, 2 sinks, in room coffee( YEAH!!!!) in room safe and a refrigerator. our room was not the upgrade to the golf course side, but we had a great view of the whole city and strip, and we had a golf course right out the window. we thought it was a lovely view, without having to pay more. we ate in almost every restaurant there and the food was excellent in all of them. BANG FOR YOUR BUCK: bottomless margaritas and endless tacos and enciladas at the mexican restaurant, all for just $9.99 and it was the BEST mexican food i have ever had. the refills were a-plenty on the margaritas, and they were excellent, too. even if you dont eat deli food, check out the deli....biggest pastries and doughnuts you have ever seen!!!!! we had late night snacks there and it was very good and inexpensive. they have wonderful desserts/pastries/cookies but they also have a variety of salads and fresh fruit plates. dont gamble? there are movie theatres and a bowling alley for you and a free bus that takes you to the strip that runs all day and into the night. there is even a newspaper at your door every morning. yes, the crowd is an older crowd, but that was ok with us. if you need more action, stay on strip, we liked the relaxed atmosphere for a change. and we LOVED our 3 days at suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sushismasher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Suncoast Hotel / Casino in May 2011. We had the most enjoyable vacation in Las Vegas. When we checked in at the front desk, the person was very friendly and informative, she made us feel special. The room was clean and spacious. From the gaming, to the restaurants, we were treated very well. We have stayed at other Las Vegas Hotels / Casinos and by far, the Suncoast gave us the best memories of our vacation. We will be back...MSN from Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Fun Time. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas regularly but usually stay downtown, in Henderson or on the Strip. We like to see new places and try out new hotels and casinos from time to time and decided to see what the Suncoast was like. We were impressed from the moment we drove in the parking lot. Very nice grounds. The layout of the casino was simple but impressive. We stayed on a Thursday and table limits were low and there's a ton of slot machines. The dealers and hotel staff were very friendly. The room was very clean and extremly spacious, the bed was on the hard side but still comfortable. While not the most luxurious place in Vegas, this one was hard to beat especially for the price. My wife and enjoyed everything about our stay at Suncoast and will be making a return visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, cozy place, laid-back, affordable”
Reviews.Author: GlennBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice so far. The main positives are listed above but also very large rooms with nice views. It's clean. It is not a chic Bellagio style hotel. If there was a non-smoking area it would be a really great place. The lower casino ceilings and rampant smokers is the main issue with the atmosphere. Otherwise the friendly dealers, pit bosses, bingo attendants and other staff do help to compensate for this. If you're a smoker I guess this place is for you but I wish you'd go to SunCoast after you stop smoking. Red wine at the tables provide a guaranteed headache so we went to gift shop, bought a nice bottle and our waitress would bring us glasses from our own bottle. The wine pricing for very good wine is excellent. We were surprised at the great selection for a small gift shop and very competitive pricing. (My wife has extensive wine knowledge.) They have comped us rooms several times and we don't consider ourselves high rollers by any stretch. If there was a no smoking area (not a huge place so would be an addition) or non-smoking I would give it 5 stars. I know it's not a fancy strip hotel but the large rooms, cleanliness, friendly staff, laid back atmosphere and convenience to see my family nearby rank 5 stars. Also the lack of the nonsense $25-$35 "resort fee" being charged daily but some other places make SunCoast more like the no-fee Southwest and much appreciated. Oh yeah, we had a baby with us one one trip and they supplied a decent crib immediately. I don't think there was a sitting service but that's what Grandma living nearby was for that trip. Cafe is decent. I either got sick on my own or my GI tract and the Mexican restaurant had a serious disagreement. We didn't eat at other places. We won at Bingo and donated it back at table games!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for number three!”
Reviews.Author: geonlank
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at Suncoast twice. Both times were excellent visits. I strongly recommend the Suncoast to anyhone who enjoys gambling, dining, and/or simply relaxing. Thanks, Suncoast, as a certain ex-governor used to say, "We'll be back!" Clean, well maintained, friendly, easy check-in and out, comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kcm53
Reviews.Content: we travel to las vegas 4-5 times a year. a mix of business and pleasure. we always stay at least a few days at the suncoast and have always had a great experience. it appears to be geared to an older crowd but the rooms are quiet, large and clean. they also have a small fridge which is a big plus if staying more than a few days.. the casino has $3 craps and live entertainment. for a comfortable room at a reasonable price suncoast is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Jessie53
Reviews.Content: The room was good for the price, but had the noise of the buildings air condining units right out side our window. No view, no frills. the hotel caters to more of a senior clientale. I became ill due to food posining and had to leave the next day. I would recommend that if you are going to stay here, upgrade the room to a golf view, in order to rest. Or you will be hearing a great humming sound all night long. Far enough away from the stip but not to far. Here is a tip request a room that the numbers are odd. You may have better luck..

Reviews.Title: “This was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: SingerTrainer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off the freeway in Summerlin. The rooms were clean, large and airy. The rooms that were off the golf course were beautiful. Good food, bowling, movies, etc. We all had a great experience with the casino, but not being on the strip and parking was great - all good experience. The meeting rooms were good. Staff most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: Suncoast is fairly far west of the strip, just off W. Charleston, and a great place to stay if you want to spend time away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and downtown. It is also fairly convenient to Red Rock Canyon (and Red Rock Casino). Right next door is the Rampart Hotel/Casino as well, so it's not like you're in the middle of nowhere. The room was big and comfortable. Check-in was fast and friendly. They have a free shuttle to the strip (it drops at the Tropicana) and you can then go to the airport from the Tropicana. They pick people up at the airport too, but it only runs every two hours. Still, I used it to get to and from the strip and it was great. The casino itself is fairly large and has a decent variety of machines, etc. The breakfast buffet is nothing special. I would recommend instead that you take a trip down Charleston and have breakfast at the Original Pancake House. And right on the corner of Charleston from where the hotel is, you will find a restaurant called the Claim Jumper which has one of the best desserts I've ever had called the "I Declair." Do yourself a favor if you have no health issues and get yourself over there and order one. Anyway, great hotel and you cannot beat the price. They do have a $5 resort fee added to the bill each night. And while that is far less than the fee imposed by the MGM resorts, for example, it's still annoying and you don't get very much for it. Still, if you're thinking about this hotel, give it a try. Lots of bang for the buck, even with the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Nice big clean room with a great view! A really great value!”
Reviews.Author: luvtodiveVA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many exclusive places. This place was a pleasant surprise for its value. Simply put, a very spacious quiet room, very clean, nice sizable bathrooms, large window with a beautiful peaceful northern view, easy parking, friendly staff - all for a very wonderful price! If you are looking for value, this is really a place to look at. Really want to hear the negatives: if you don't know Vegas, you will need to get used to casinos being everywhere, including them being in the lobbies of all your hotels. Sometimes these casinos can be unpleasant to walk through because smoking is permitted in them, there is a constant electronic jingle of the slot machines, and sometimes the ventilation isn't always adequate to clear the air. Since this is true of most hotels in Las Vegas, this isn't a real negative against Suncoast. The other negative is that the room service food was a little disappointing. This hotel had multiple restaurants which I did not take advantage of, so I am certain there is a lot of dining here that won't disappoint anyone. I did NOT take advantage of the 16 screen movie theatre, the 64-lane bowling alley, the arcade, the multiple restaurants, the variety show, the casino, the pool, the fitness center, or any of the other services the hotel provides. Just wasn't interested in any of these personally. But I knew they were available. For the family who is looking for lots of activities, this hotel can provide the entertainment. Strictly speaking, if you are looking for a really nice room and want to spend your money on the entertainment Las Vegas has to offer, instead of on a room, this is a great place to try.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LynLee97
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get away from our snow but did not want to stay on the strip. The Suncoast was delightful! It was quiet (not so many kids), had a nice hot tub, bowling alley, reasonable spa, plenty of restaurants, could walk to the shopping center near the hotel, curteous staff, very clean. We will definitely want to stay here again! Julie was great in helping us get a good deal (3 nights with one free) and Emmy gave a great facial massage.

Reviews.Title: “Driving trip to Las Vegas from Southern Colorado”
Reviews.Author: gigdeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I set out on our driving trip in bad weather on Saturday, February 26. We made it as far as Flagstaff, AZ (350 miles) before making our stop for the night at the Ramada Grand Canyon West. Thanks to research I had done on TA, I made this choice for our first night and we were not disappointed. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the price was right - $43 for the night. This was just a quick stopover to our final destination – the Suncoast in Las Vegas. The weather report called for up to 12 inches of new snow overnight, so we slept fitfully, getting up every few hours to check outside to see how much snow had fallen. Fortunately, we left Flagstaff with no new accumulation, but the closer we got to Kingman, the harder the snow flew. We arrived safely mid-morning in Las Vegas and were glad to see that our non-smoking double queens room at the Suncoast was ready and waiting for us to check in at 11:00 A.M. We were upgraded to a golf-course view (with floor to ceiling big wide windows and an awesome view) and tipped the clerk a quick $20 for her trouble. The beds were wonderful – probably the best I have ever had in all the years of staying in hotels. Now, I have a bad back and like my mattress firm – these mattresses must have been relatively new, and they felt just right on my tired body. The room was 500 square feet, with a separate area for toilet and shower. The shower pressure was nice and strong and the hot water was abundant. There was never any trace of cigarette smoke and we did not notice any overwhelming odor of smoke at any time in the casino, either. When we stepped out of the elevator on the 5th floor, I saw a pretty woman who I recognized as Sparkysmom from her TA avatar – I was delighted to find out that it was indeed, Jewel from Michigan, who was at the Suncoast with her husband and son for a few days. I had been reading her posts on TA and knew that she was going to be there. We had a chance later on in the week to spend some time (while I played video keno) getting to know each other. What a nice gal! We played golf at Angel Park (both Mountain and Palms courses) on Monday and Wednesday at a rate of $75 each and found it extremely convenient to utilize their free pick up and delivery by golf cart. For a municipal course, Angel Park has the best customer service that we have ever encountered. We will definitely plan to play their again. The Mountain course was challenging for me, as I think I was in and out of every single trap out there – my husband shot a nice round in the low 90’s and I shot a 115 (I have a 25 handicap). The Palms course was a little more welcoming and my husband shot an 86 while I carded a 102 – both of us even got birdies on this round – this is a rarity for me, I can tell you. We ate dinner in the St. Tropez buffet (mediocre at best with chicken being the predominant dish, probably because it is so inexpensive), Café Siena (best thing about it was that I had a chance to practice my German by conversing with one of the waitresses, Christine), SC Prime Steakhouse (where we had a problem using our restaurant.com gift certificate, but the meal was great). On Sunday evening, we took the free Suncoast shuttle (dropped us off at the Tropicana) and saw Barry Manilow – I know many of you might think that this is a concert for old fogies, but quite honestly, this was one of the best concerts we have ever been to. He did not lip synch as he continually updated us with the winners of the Academy Awards, singing “at the Copa, Copa Cabana, Natalie Portman won for Black Swan – I hated that movie”……he didn’t even miss a beat. We found out later by reading her trip report that the nice couple we sat next to was no other than Warmwinds! What a small world!!!! Tuesday was a trip via taxi to downtown. I had hoped my luck would change by visiting the Golden Nugget and 4 Queens – I was wrong and bad gambling luck followed me throughout my entire trip. It seems like I never saw even 1 hand pay and did not hear the usual hooting and hollering coming from the tables. We left for home on Thursday morning, making it as far as Albuquerque, where we stayed at Sandia Resort and Casino – the bed here was so badly worn down that I ended up sleeping on the floor. I advised the front desk of the problem upon checkout and they did not offer to make any adjustments to our bill. Sandia’s rooms are very nice, but their beds have consistently been a problem for me. The best thing about Sandia is that they have wonderful, large, fluffy bath towels. We drove home Friday morning and hit a bad snowstorm about 100 miles from home. There were many accidents and slide offs along the interstate, but we arrived safe and sound and are looking forward to our next trip to Las Vegas. Maybe we’ll fly next time.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bridget92
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is an excellent Hote/Casino in the best neighborhood in Las Vegas. The service and staff are the most professional and friendly I have met. From the moment you check in you're treated as family. The atmosphere is not overwhelming and the restaurants and shows are among the very best in Las Vegas. Red Rock Canyon is within 9 miles of the hotel and is one the most beautiful areas in all of Las Vegas. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: SandyPerkinson
Reviews.Content: We received two free weekend nights from Suncoast. Our room was spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. Whenever we saw an employee they greeted us and were willing to assist! We had to book an extra night and it was very reasonable. I experienced Pure Spa which is on site. WOW! They offered a great combo spa treatment which was to die for!
