The buffet resturant was also better then expected. Usually buffets are pretty boring but theirs was actually pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto the previous review by Birdlady07”
Reviews.Author: Tralika
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Suncoast while visiting family in Las Vegas. Birdlady07 gave about as thorough a review as I've seen in the previous post. I agree with just about everything she said so I guess I don't need to repeat it. We had a big room with all the amenities and a spectacular view overlooking the golf course, all for $50 a night (weekdays, booked on the internet). The hotel tacked on a service charge of $5 a night for the phone, fridge, TV, in room safe, etc. At first I was ticked off about that but even at $55 a night it was a real bargain. I'll stay there again the next time I visit family in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: birdlady07
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at The Suncoast Hotel in Las Vegas. Room had the following amenities: Comfy sofa, big screen t.v., comfortable bed, pillows that weren't too hard or soft (just right), phone in room and in bathroom, good water pressure from shower, non-slip tub, oatmeal massage soap (felt terrific especially on my sore feet), refrigerator, room safe (easy to use), nice desk and chair, bathroom with two sinks, plenty of towels, coffee-maker, cups, large mirror. Ironing board also in room (closet). There was a mirror upon entering the room. In addition, the hotel delivers USA today newspaper to each room everyday. The casino had all of the games you could want, so no need to go elsewhere for gambling. I enjoyed eating at the Bagel Cafe. They had delicious bagels (asiago) and deli-style sandwiches. Near the bowling alley, there is a business center and two internet computers. I used the computer to print up my boarding pass. There is a fee for the computer. The fee depends on how long you use the internet. Parking is free and the parking garage is easy to navigate. There is a shopping center close to the hotel and restaurants, including fast food like McDonald's and The Cheesecake Factory. It takes about 30-40 minutes to get to the strip from The Suncoast. One negative thing I can say about the hotel is that they didn't have The Weather Channel on the t.v. In fact, not too many channels to choose from. I wasn't in the room much, but I did want to see the local weather. I would stay at The Suncoast again. I would recommend anyone who stays at The Suncoast to have a car. They have a shuttle that goes to the strip, but only at certain times. Besides the strip, you'll want to visit Red Rock Canyon (a short drive away) for some scenic beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: yupiler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Suncoast for 3 nights. I had a very positive experience and highly recommend it. The room is on par with other 3.5 and 4 stars hotels such as Hilton and Hyatt, perhaps bigger. Here are the main things to know about the hotel: -Location: it's not located near the strip (it's more than 10 miles away). its location is good for visiting Red Rock Canyon (which I did). -Wireless internet is NOT free. You have to pay about $13 per day. -there is a free Shuttle to/from the Airport (which I used) and Strip (I did not use). -Car rental: Hertz is nearby, and Avis (which I used) provides free pickup/dropoff. My experience was as follows: -Room was SPACIOUS. Loved the floor-to-ceiling window overlooking the hotel pool, golf course, and mountains (I asked for a room with good view at checkin). Bathroom was very spacious as well, with a divider between the sink and the tub & toilet. -Loved the cafe with $9 prime ribs and $12 porterhouse steak. It also has cheap Chinese dishes. -A previous review said the rooms are sound-proof. My room was not, as I could hear doors closing down the hall. Nothing terribly loud though. I would stay at Suncoast Hotel again if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the cost”
Reviews.Author: voldan
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on the suncoast through Expedia (30$ a night for 5 nights sunday-friday). At first we were given room 548. The entire floor is supposed to be a non smoking floor but the room smelled of smoking. We asked for a king sized bed but unfortunately they only had two beds. The room itself was clean and very spacious and the bathroom large and divided into two "rooms" one for the bathtub and toilet and the other (entrance) with two sinks. The room was facing the roof of part of the hotel which had air conditioners on it, this led to a horrible noise which made it very hard to sleep at night. In addition the water pressure in the room was almost non existent. At first when we asked to change rooms we were told there was nothing possible, only after going to a different receptionist the next night were we given an upgrade to a different room (room 757). This new room was much better being quiet and the water pressure while being very bad was better than the first room. The room had an LCD tv, a safe large enough for a laptop and a fridge. The hotel itself is off strip, about 20 minutes away (depending on traffic). There is a resort fee of 5$ which is mandatory (although you can decide not to get a newspaper and get 75 cents back). Internet costs extra. There is a T.G.I friday in the hotel which provides room service. Pros: A spacious clean room Cons: bad water pressure, 5th floor is noisy and has smell of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Be Back Soon!”
Reviews.Author: Maralyne
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay though too short.... and for me that says a lot because I am always ready to go home, but this time I wasn't and could have used a couple more days at Suncoast. I booked based upon reviews for the cleanliness and can't say I was terribly disappointed though I did find used dental floss on the bathroom floor upon check-in. Also found a purple ponytail holder on the carpet on the second day - not sure where that came from, certainly not mine. Another reason for booking was the complimentary airport shuttle - this proved to be a disaster. The number for making the shuttle reservation listed on the Suncoast web site gets you to someone who doesn't know about the shuttle. My suggestion would be to send the caller to a recording giving very specific and explicit instructions of where to find the shuttle. We waited over two hours and ended up renting a car thanks to really lousy instructions on the part of the person on the phone at Suncoast not giving a specific exit door at McCarran to look for the shuttle. Fortunately the trip got much better from this point!!! Loved the spacious room with the floor-to-ceiling windows, the beautiful view, separate "living room" with excellent lighting for reading, the granite countertops and double sinks in bathroom, separate toilet/shower, refrigerator in the room, flat screen television (though very limited channels to choose from) and housekeeping was invisible yet met all of my requests for an extra towel or toiletry items. The purpose of the trip was a Thanksgiving getaway with the focus off casinos and chowing down. We wanted to do some sightseeing and we did - Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon & Gift of Lights holiday light display at Las Vegas Motor Speedway. We also wanted to just chill and have fun so Suncoast was perfect with the on-site movie theater and bowling. I really appreciated the fact the location is in a clean and quiet area (Summerlin) and I absolutely recommend this to anyone who is turned off by the sleazy/seedy Strip hotels. Having stayed on the Strip before I get annoyed at having people constantly trying to divert me from my vacation right in the hotel where I am staying - the sales team disguised as an information or concierge desk, where you don't dare appear the slightest bit lost or confused or you will find yourself at the mercy of salespeople trying to shove you into a timeshare or lure you with "free" show tickets. We totally avoided the Strip this trip and didn't miss it one bit. No "pornslappers" in Summerlin (slimy-looking people handing out cards for "companionship" from gauntlet-like lines all along the Strip; so named for the snapping sound they make trying to slap their porn cards into your hands...)!!! I also appreciated the soundproofing that must have taken place when Suncoast was built - the rooms are very quiet and I am a light sleeper. One evening I returned to my room and saw there were two (maybe more) guys in the next room and one was thoroughly intoxicated and I thought, "Great, so much for getting any sleep tonight!" but was wrong - not a sound from the next room did I hear. Slots are tight thought the casino is full of a local "after-work" crowd each day. The TGI Fridays had "happy hour" specials but managed to have such slow service that we were charged full-price by the time it was said and done. We ate there our first night. I don't recommend this restaurant - go elsewhere. We had Thanksgiving Buffet here and it was good and reasonably priced. Other than that we ate off-site or brought food back with us, there is a Von's supermarket close by in Boca Plaza so we went there the first morning and loaded up on bottled water, deli food for our outdoor/hiking trips, etc... Found out upon checkout that the adjacent golf course is public and has a walking trail that is accessible from Suncoast - plan to utilize that on the next trip. Red Rock Canyon was my favorite part of the trip - very close to Suncoast. There is a turnout before RRC called Red Spring with nice restrooms, covered picnic area, grills and an informative walking path - totally FREE, so be sure to stop here and bring some deli food. a picnic basket or meat for the grill. Hoover Dam was impressive and glad I went. We stopped at Railroad Pass Hotel & Casino in Henderson and enjoyed great food (prime rib or ribeye dinner w/ all the extras) for well under $10 per person. They also has strawberry shortcake for just a buck but we were too full for dessert so didn't try that. Food was great and friendly servers. The day we went to Hoover Dam we had actually planned to drive around Lake Mead. We took Lake Mead Blvd. out of Las Vegas and we were very disappointed that the landscape as far as the eyes could see was littered with broken glass. When we got to the Lake Mead entrance station we commented on all of the broken glass and we were basically told it's a pretty unsavory area, especially at night. We never really got to see Lake Mead, just the Boulder Basin area that wasn't that pretty, then dropped down to see Hoover Dam, then through Boulder City to Railroad Pass then back to Suncoast. Next trip I will do it differently - go North on I-15 to 169, then see the Valley of Fire, Lake Mead, and then exit via 564/Lake Mead Parkway.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay away from the strip and downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pvanyo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Suncoast was wonderful. We had a beautiful room that overlooked the golf course and we had a very scenic view of the mountains. We had everything we needed or wanted right here without going downtown or to the strip. We will go back there again if we are ever back in Las Vegas. The staff was very helpful to us as well as the valet and bellman. The food was good whether it was hot dogs or hot beef.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, great scenery”
Reviews.Author: tkjbd
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed for aa week in July. Great central location, free shuttle to the strip,Beautiful rooms at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: tennispat
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night when flying out of las vegas. Check in staff was very friendly, room had beautiful view of golf course and pool. room was VERY large, new, comfortable. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, in the middle of nowhere and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Joe_33
Reviews.Content: Pluses: A big room Good views of the Strip (about 8 miles away) A good shopping center about 1 mile away (with a McDonalds and Whole Foods Market). A very good price - $50 per night plus tax and plus a $5 resort fee. Clean A big bathroom. A refrigerator in the room. Air conditioning that worked but rumbled. Negatives: A long way from the Strip - traffic was heavy between the Strip and the hotel and it was a very unpleasant journey during rush hour. The fans in the casino roof emit a low-pitched rumble and it goes on all night. I was OK with ear plugs (ear plugs in a new hotel!) but my companion had a very poor night's sleep. No breakfast in the price - paid breakfast from on-sight restaurants. A long haul from the car park through the casino to the room. When you are tired or carrying suitcases or don't know the way this can seem like a long journey. $12.95 per 24 hours for internet access. It is free for 2 hours at Whole Foods about 1 miles away. I know the hotel is charging a low price but amount of this additional fee is excessive. There is no free internet access anywhere in the hotel. A very restricted choice of TV channels and lots of time working through the hotel's betting screens before getting to the few TV channels there were. Most people come to Las Vegas for the Strip or Fremont Street. This hotel is a long way from both. I would have preferred to pay more for a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser73
Reviews.Content: Very economical, enjoyable stay... close to, but far enough away from the strip! A friendly slot machine helped make our stay even more memorable! Surprised that the Suncoast still charges for (wireless) Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, outstanding accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: 2pks
Reviews.Content: About 7 miles west of the strip with conveniet freeway access. Large, comfortable, very clean rooms. Floor to ceiling windows. This is probably best value in Las Vegas if you stay midweek. Shower-toilet area separate from double sink dressing area. Large separate sitting, work area. Very quiet room with outstanding views of golf course and northern Las Vegas. As former Las Vegas residents, we were there to visit friends and did not want the congestion of the strip hotels, so this property met our needs very well. Only negative as with most casino hotels, you have to walk through smoke filled casino to get to the room elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: superbarn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out away from the congested strip. They have a shuttle but we rented a car. We had a beautiful view of the golf course and mountains. We would pick this hotel above all others.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast is a great place to stay with friendly staff and beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: threebritts
Reviews.Content: Stay here often because its a great place to stay! The rooms are very roomy and beautiful view of golf course and the staff is exceptionally nice and go out of the way to make sure you ar well cared for! Definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again in november!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying at the Suncoast. Ditto to all the other positive reviews. Big rooms (ask for a golf course side view); very clean; great shower. Yes, I wish they would just roll the $5 resort fee into the room rate. It's so bogus. Who cares if I am asked to pay $54 instead of $49. This is a great value hotel as long as you're willing to stay way off The Strip. Two complaints (which prevent my overall rating to be 5 stars): 1) The Internet fee of $12.99 per day; and 2) the towels could be somewhat more substantial and the room decor is rather old. But the bed is terrific, I was comfortable, slept really well. The casino is decent on several levels -- it attracts a middle class, down-to-earth crowd that is mostly locals who are just nice to sit with. Minimum bets are low. They have Single Deck Black Jack for $5 minimum. Yes, I wish people wouldn't smoke at the table, but I didn't find the casino overall to be smokey. If I can get a $49 (err, $54) rate or better next visit, I will definately stay at this place again. Who needs The Strip?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to ttay!!!”
Reviews.Author: chofsvm
Reviews.Content: The staff there was Great!! The room I booked was not available, The staff upgraded me to a suite at no extra cost!!! Location is fantastic if you are there to play golf! I will not stay on the strip again. This place has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms, Friendly Staff, Smokey Casino”
Reviews.Author: DB3201
Reviews.Content: When you first walk into the hotel, you have to go through the casino to get to the registration desk as well as the elevators for the rooms. It's so smokey in the casino you can hardly breathe. That wasn't a great first impression, but once I got up to the rooms it really made up for it! I was in a king room with a fairway view and it was amazing. The view was like something from a photo. The room was very clean and large. Every morning they leave a USA Today outside your door. I didn't have to deal with the staff too much (just at check in and check out) and they were very friendly and professional. Not much nightlife around, but there is a lot of shopping and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay to get away from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: aburg2
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is a great place to bring the whole family. There is something to do for everyone, movies, bowling, arcade, and the FOOD!!!! Outstanding restaurants! Also, take in a concert if you get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in town”
Reviews.Author: yayinny
Reviews.Content: Since the Suncoast opened it is my favorite place for gambling, and dining. You are always a winner here. The restaurants have the best food. The employees are the friendlies,t always remember your name and greet you like family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Views”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: We spent one evening at Suncoast and were very impressed with the hotel and variety of restaurants. Our room was very spacious and overlooked the pool and surrounding mountains. For $50.00/night it was a real value. The hotel has lots of dining choices with a steak house, gourmet Italian, Mexican, an oyster bar, a buffet, coffee shop and others. We had dinner at the Mexican restaurant and it was very good with giant Margaritas! Gaming is fun here with lower table minimums than most hotels, and the sports book is nice sized. I wish the hotel offered keno which I like to play while dining. The location is about 20 minutes from the strip which is a plus for me as it is less hectic and less touristy. The hotel pool is beautiful and relaxing with plenty of sun and shade. Only real drawback I can think of is the trek through the casino with your luggage from the hotel check-in desk to the elevators. We only had one night to stay here and wish it were more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, family friendly atmospere...activities for all.”
Reviews.Author: lethlwipn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Found the hotel to be very accomodating. Many choices for meals, 1 cafe, 1 buffet, a high end Italian restaurant as well as steakhouse. We didn't try the oyster/sushi bar but it was always packed. We ate at the TGI Friday's a few times which also servers out at the poolside. The pool and surrounding area were in perfect shape and clean. Our kids swam in it everyday and met many new friends from all over the country. Wednesday night there was a concert (21 and over) at the poolside from 8-10 pm....great band, very fun night. 60+ lane bowling alley, video arcade and a movie theater all on site for the kids to enjoy. Can't wait to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Home”
Reviews.Author: carolrae46
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas in November each year to visit my sister.We stay at the Suncoast so we can be close to her home in Summerlin and have a resort vacation feeling anytime.The rooms are great,plenty variety of wonderful food,staff are top notch.The casino is very generous with wins regularly.We can't say enough good things about this home away from home.I'm never ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: PattiontheGo
Reviews.Content: We got such a deal here ($26.99) which included $10/day in food and a $5 casino voucher- that we were nervous about it. It was wonderful. The room was beautiful, big and clean with a refrigerator in the room. The window was the whole wall, floor to ceiling with a wonderful view of the mountains, golf course and pool. We were on the 8th floor. The casino was a little smoky at times and not as glitzy as on the Strip. It has easy access to the freeway and is about 15 mins. to the Strip. You would need a car to get anywhere, although they do have a shuttle to the Strip and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Poor slot hostess”
Reviews.Author: woody1417
Reviews.Content: Hotel is too far off the strip to give lousy service from repeat clientele. Slot hostess really does nothing for you. Why have them if the card promotion is all you can obtain. Bagel coffee shop, horrible and only thing open 24 hours. Their coffee shop closes early. We have been going there for at least 3 years but they would give us only free room. I get this already from other hotels and more. The rooms are very nice and the golf view is excellent. I would not recommend since too far off the strip for the value of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “There Are Better Places to Stay in Vegas Without Spending More $$$”
Reviews.Author: corvairmaven
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is adequate, but there are nicer places to stay at a reasonable cost. On entry, the casino area greats each new guest with the unmistakable aroma/odor of stale smoke. Not surprising, but other hotel/casinos do a much better job of ventilating and extracting those smells. (I have been known to smoke an occasional cigar, so I'm not averse to anyone's prerogative to light up, especially in a casino, just don't fancy smelling the stale aftermath). The rooms are... well, roomy. Plenty of square feet, but the cotton shirt that I laid out on the sofa carried some sort of stale smell in the fabric until its next washing. The hallways are more dimly lighted than other places. Overall there's just an ambiance of "tired" that doesn't justify the "resort fee" tacked onto the bill. Neither 'tired' nor 'resort fee' are a necessity and aren't encountered in places like South Point, which is priced similarly and, for my money, much more upbeat, odor-free and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: dusty1956
Reviews.Content: Great staff from check in, to house-keeping, shuttle drivers. did not find the casino smoky and it was being continually cleaned. Pool area great and eat in all food areas except steak house upstairs and all were very good and we cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: MBilek
Reviews.Content: We booked the Suncoast for my husband's birthday weekend because it was very reasonably priced, and we did not want to stay on the strip (we aren't into clubbing). While the majority of the clientele were older than us (I am 29 and my husband is 35), we still had a blast! The casino was great (A little smokey, but not too bad. I don't smoke and am usually really sensitive to cigarette smoke, but I never had an issue the entire time we were there). The dealers were very friendly and helpful. Our room was huge, and spotless. My husband was also very impressed with the size of the sports book. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site, so I can't comment on those, but we had so much fun that we are already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: Well, the room was very large, and the water pressure in the shower was fine. Those are the best things I have to say about the hotel. Other than that, there was a real problem with attention to detail. The casino is impossibly smoky, even by Vegas standards - just from the time that it took me to walk through it, check in and get upstairs, my hair and clothes smelled like smoke. Of course, it didn't help that I had to wait a while for check-in - there was only one person at the desk, and she was not only dealing with walk in reservations, but also apparenly managing the phone reservation line as well as fielding complaints from a tipsy patron who apparently couldn't cash out on his slot machine (you'd think she could have referred him to some type of pit boss or floor staff?). I was on a non-smoking floor, and it was pretty good, although there was also a faint smell of smoke in the bathroom that seemed to be coming from the ventilation. The bed was a bit saggy, and the linens were pretty awful - scratchy as heck. The room was desperately in need of a good cleaning - in particular, the bedside tables had a marble-ish type top, and the housekeeper had apparently not noticed that they were, well, really sticky. There are few things more disconcerting than a sticky nightstand, and if I hadn't been exhausted and unwilling to deal with the front desk lines, I would have gone back downstairs to request a different room. Finally, the TV remote didn't work, which made it impossible to check out electronically. Luckily, after I called around a bit, I was able to check out over the phone since I had prepaid and not used the minbar or anything else - when I left, there was again a long line at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel minutes from the strip or downtown”
Reviews.Author: Bethannsd65
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas every few months, and normally stay on the strip. This time I wanted to be out of the hustle and bustle, but close enough to get to the MGM for a concert. This hotel was wonderful. I was upgraded to a suite without even asking. The suite was huge....large living room with full bar, a huge dining area, 2 large flat screen TV's, and a separate bedroom and a HUGE bathroom, complete with a TV as well. The front desk staff was incredibly nice, valet parking was fast, the bakery/bagel place was inexpensive with fast pleasant service. The room and hallways did not smell smokey, which is a huge issue for me. I would stay here again. The drive to the MGM was 13 minutes, as a note.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret !”
Reviews.Author: Candace154914
Reviews.Content: Suncoast is off the strip about 20-30 minutes depending on how you drive. Vegas is easy to get around if you do rent a car. I have stayed in several LV hotels both on and off the strip but I honestly can say I was surprised at how nice the rooms were. The views are spectacular - mountains and golf courses- very peaceful. I'm a corner checker - I hate to see dirt in the corners of the bathrooms - every square inch was spotless! The crisp snow white bed covers reassured me of the cleanliness. We felt like we had a suite by both the size and the amenities. As we kept late nights we wanted to sleep The choice of restaurants is nicely varied and even has a Seattle's Best for the coffee drinker. They bring in some great music bands. I can't say enough about the well mannered and pleasant staff. Despite the line up check in was quick and pleasant. Loved the pool & hot tub with the views of the mountains. Close to great shopping (5 min walk) , 15 minute from Red Rock Canyon State Park( rock climbing, varied degrees of hiking easy to tough), 20 min to Bonnie Springs (rustic restaurant, zoo fun for all ages) I would recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: force25
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast Hotel and Casino has become our home away from home. We are treated like family on our return visits. It's nice to see familiar faces; the casino staff and restaurant staff. We especially enjoy the Oyster Bar Restaurant. The hotel rooms are beautiful, comfortable, clean, and roomy. The golf course and mountain views are beautiful while having breakfast. We always rent a car to visit some of our favorite places. Enterprise rent a car is right up the road; they pick you up at the hotel and drop you off when you are done with the car. The distance between the strip and downtown is REALLY not a problem. The location and atmosphere is laid back away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and there is a Cheesecake Factory across the street where we always visit at least once while we are there. All in all, if you visit Las Vegas to relax and do some casual gambling, this is a gem of a place to stay. We would highly recommend the Suncoast, but rent a car if you want to check out the rest of the city......Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A HIDDEN GEM OF A DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: verda
Reviews.Content: This resort was away from the strip, but the rooms are mini suites, with a sitting area, refridgerators, coffee makers, floor to ceiling window and very friendly and efficient housekeeping staff. Be sure to get their free member card for the casino as you can get free meals, discount on purchases including alcohol and other promotions. Their pool area was very nice and inviting and very clean. They have a large casino with all the gaming activities as on the strip, but with better pay-offs(my opinion). They also have a great Italian Restaurant with a great piano bar.The food was delicious with specials of the day at reasonable prices. The piano bar was always crowded with the piano player performing a variety of music.If you visit Las Vegas and want a true deal, check out Suncoast. They are about 20 min drive from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: WoHop132
Reviews.Content: A great spot off the strip to relax and still feel like you're in Vegas. Bowling and Movies in one building. Restaurants are wonderful. Breakfast buffet was very nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: SHIP5182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights before moving to the Wynn for three nights, the Suncoast room was almost as nice as the room at the Wynn, if the Suncoast would have had seperate tub/shower I would rate it as good as the Wynn. You will need a car if you stay here, twenty to thirty minute ride to the strip depending on traffic. The eating places are very good at about half the price of the strip. I had the Prime Rib Special at their Cafe for $8.99, a great deal. We also ate at Salvetories, their Italian Restrauant, very nice atmosphere and reasonable prices. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnlcruise
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Great hotel. Sevice was outstanding. From check-in to check out staff was very friendly. Also the casino staff where OUTSTANDING. Very friendly and willing to help you if you don't understand a game. Plenty of things to do in the hotel from bowling to a movie thearter. Pool was nice but small. The Spa pool has great jets. Felt like I was getting a message. Rooms are very clean and update. Food in all the resturants where good. Yes this hotel is away from the strip. About 15 min. But if you have done the strip like we have done so may times (seen it and done it) and you really dont want to leave the resort. Then this is the place to go and relax for a few days. Casino has lots of regular players. We got to know alot of locals at the tables and heard great stories.. If you want to go to the strip there is a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're looking for off the strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick78
Reviews.Content: I was pleasently surprised with my stay here. I always stay off the strip due to visiting family and wanting to keep costs down and tried the suncoast based on my fathers last stay. The room was large, overlooked the pool and mountains and was quiet (even though in the hall you could hear there was a baby on the floor crying in the room you heard nothing). They do have a bus to the airport and strip but I didn't use either of these. If you're looking for something cheep, with low resort fees, off the strip, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, good food and will always return here.”
Reviews.Author: sandybushinger
Reviews.Content: Make reservations as early as possible. Great service having shuttles to the strip if you wish. Nice outdoor pool and workout room. Bowling, movie theater, 18 hole golf near by and several excellent restaurants. Will always recommend this hotel, casino to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secrect in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: yankee2k
Reviews.Content: great pool good and reasonable food Phil Baker at the piano bar in the is a great way to spend an eveing

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be going downhill ever so slightly”
Reviews.Author: topemaryland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2008 and 2009 - everything was great in 2008 - gave them a $20.00 tip at check in and the fell all over themselves - giving me chocolade, coupons, upgrade to a golfcourse view and apologized the could not give me even a better upgrade. The room was very nice and clean and in excellent condition. The buffet was great for breakfast and dinner and a great value. Then in 2009 - gave them again a $20.00 at check-in - they did not seem very impressed - they did upgrade me to a golf course view, but even though the room had the same layout, it was not in as good a condition as before, just slightly shabby and not cleaned as spotlessly as the year before. The buffet also went downhill a little - especially the dinner (cut of prime rib was not nearly as good as the year before). The drink service in the casino also seemed to have declined and I noticed some frayed carpeting here and there. I really like this place and hope this is not a trend that will continue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great staff hospitality and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: blancojb
Reviews.Content: New and upgraded casino machines! Great hostesses, neat and great food. Meet Chef Pedro while eating and he would recommend and give good food and food tips!

Reviews.Title: “Boyd Gaming properties & personal go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay.”
Reviews.Author: lstaab
Reviews.Content: I personally have been associated with the Boyd Gaming people & properties since 1985 and my wife since 1995. This says a lot as to why we keep coming back. We enjoy the hotels and what they have to offer. The rooms are excellent and it's the people who work at the properties that we enjoy also as friends. We normally stay at Sam's and enjoy the SunCoast. I have used Sam's and the Orleans for various business meetings. You are a first class organization. Thanks, Larry Staab & Cindy Mackey (wife)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: knc81
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It was quiet, clean and comfortable. The room was large. It provided a very comfortable bed (wish it had a heavier blanket), comfy pillows and a pillow top mattress. Plenty of storage, blow dryer, great toiletries, iron and board. Plenty of light. The bathroom was almost as big as the room. With a separate room for the toilet and tub/shower combo. The hot water was plentiful and powerfully strong. The sinks (in a separate room were huge with plenty of counter space. This hotel is so close to Sumerlin were my daughter lives and the price we paid was exceptionally fair. We paid $44 through an online website. This is one of the best hotels we ever stayed at. We didn't use the cute pool or hot tub. Didn't eat at their buffet restaurant but went to the bagel shop and got an egg sandwich on delicious bagel for .99 cents. This is a lovely, lovely place

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTripTaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 15 minutes from the strip, on a golf course. I chose it because they were offering a $49 rate and I had business in that part of town. My room was large and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I used the gym, which was clean and well equipped. I appreciated the fact that they did not have a bunch of hidden fees. (They was a $5.00 resort fee, which they told you about when you booked the room.) I only have two complaints about this hotel: They don't offer free Internet and the connection was a little pricey. Also, they require 72 hours if you want to cancel, which is longer than the 24 hours required by most hotels. If you cancel within 72 hours of your scheduled arrival, they charge you a penalty equal to one night's stay. On a $49 room, I was willing to risk it, but it would make me hesitant to book a more expensive room. All in all, I would stay here again for business, but if I were vacationing I would rather be on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: monica033
Reviews.Content: service from front desk , to restaurant , to dealers , to chambermaids , could not have been better . room was large , clean ,bright ,with large screen t v . ask for view of golf course , beatifull . price was a third of what you would spend on strip . spent 3 days at paris , 3 days at luxor , and 3 days at suncoast . suncoast wins every catagory , hands down . shuttle service to the strip every 2 hours , on time , to and from . food was very good , great variety ,great price . if you are looking to have a great time in vegas without waiting in line for everything , and paying 3 times as much , relax and try the suncoast , you wont regret it . ive stayed at every major hotel on strip over a period of 25 yrs. and i am no longer searching . thesuncoast has it all .

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, but much older clientele”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal ($50) for a King non-smoking room. We were surprised by the generous size of the room, and the fridge, granite counters, and flat screen TV. While the general population in the casino is elderly, we had fun gambling. The pool area was nice, but the pool was freezing!! Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a value-option. It's not luxurious, but it was perfect for our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “REWARD YOURSELF AT SUNCOAST HOTEL AND CASINO”
Reviews.Author: bugsie45
Reviews.Content: I have spent many times at the Suncoast playing slots and some table games,but most of my time has been spent playing ( BINGO ) regular and tournament,,, playing flaming seven slots, and twenty one black jack. the rest of my time is in the jacuzzi and work out in the physical exercise room..I ask for a king sise bed and reciive it, very comfortable..Great resturants and buffet spread .. I have recomended this hotel and casino to every one l meet..

Reviews.Title: “fun, exciting, relaxing, and over all excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: catchall4
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful, the room's were beautifull and confortable, It had all the ammities you could ask for. The views from our floor to celing windows where awsome of the Red Rock mountain's, and the valley with there beautiful night light's. The beautiful green golf course that was below us. Swimming and the spa were just there for our pleasure. The restaurant there was wonderful and everyone there was so nice and friendly in the Seinna cafe. Prices were very reasonable. You recieved a free morning newpaper everyday...

Reviews.Title: “Not so much Suncoast - more like Cloudcoast....”
Reviews.Author: mrfd1979
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the Bellagio (as if you would?!).... but if you book a cheap deal on a good website, you may get a cheap night's sleep, nothing more. We booked it as a stopover (cheap at £30) before continuing our drive into Death Valley. It smells of stale smoke & old people, restaurants are BAD and pricey for what they are. It has the atmosphere of a mortuary (watching people losing vast sums of money at 9am while quaffing an overly sugary bagel and 3rd rate coffee - our breakfast). Rooms are generously big, but dated & with mix-n-match furniture (i.e. don't trust the hotel's pictures on the website).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: GeoPeg14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SunCoast as part of a youth soccer travel team to a Las Vegas tournament. While we were happy to be staying off the strip, we weren't really sure what we were getting into. We were very happy to find the rooms to be clean and large. Despite frequent walks through the casino (which we knew we would have to do), it was about as family friendly as any casion I have been in. Food was good for the price. If you have to go to Las Vegas and get a lite/clean version of the casino experience, this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: Estalex
Reviews.Content: We have been regular patrons of the Suncoast for many years and this trip we were shocked and dismayed to be charged over $27.00 for two telephone calls to Arizona, total time no more than three minutes. This excessive charge leaves a terrible memory of our usual super trip. No information was given as to these large charges before the calls were made. No one minds paying a bit more to use the hotel's phone but this was really over the top. Sandra Macintyre, Phoenix, AZ

Reviews.Title: “The Suncoast never disapoints us, its a spectacular well run hotel & casino for couples and/or families”
Reviews.Author: ChiefL80
Reviews.Content: When we go to Vegas a couple of times a year we try to get a way from the hustle of the strip. The Suncoast rooms are very nice and clean. The help can't do enough for you. The restaurants are real good. Real nice transportation shuttle system back and forth to airport and strip. Nice comps when you game. Nice local atmosphere and feel to the facility. If you like movies and or bowling you do not even have to leave the property everything's is at your finger tips. A great place to come and unwind or step it up.

Reviews.Title: “Not one thing disappointed us!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon064
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were friendly and accommodated our needs. Our room was clean and very spacious, and our maid service was friendly and courteous. Located off the strip in Summerlin, but convenient to get to airport and "strip" hotels and casinos. The movie theatre located on property, bowling alley, and golf course all give the opportunity to do other things if you want a break from gaming. Food at this property is very good in all of their resturants, and we especially liked the "Champagne Brunch" on Sunday, which was a great way to celebrate Valentines Day!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: onatonequest
Reviews.Content: I have regular business trips to Las Vegas and need a hotel off the strip. My trips require meeting space and full amenities as frequently I am with colleagues in meetings with clients. The Sun Coast Hotel / Casino has it all....off strip location, close to Badlands Golf Club, SC Prime restaurant on the second level, meeting facilities, pool, gaming if you want it, and a first class service staff. I can use other facilities but I always go back to the Sun Coast and I have NEVER had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “liked room a lot”
Reviews.Author: desertfor123456
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Vegas, so can`t compare with Strip hotels. Initially was going to stay on Strip, but very glad I stayed in Summerlin away from downtown because Suncoast not crowded or frenetic. Easy self-parking in patrolled lot. Room is quite large, with big windows, mini-fridge, in-room safe, large flat screen TV, separate toilet/tub and sink/vanity areas, closed closet. wired & wireless internet for a fee, decent choice of onsite restaurants. 10 minute walk to Von`s grocery, McDonalds, other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: b4nafter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Very clean, nice size, big bathroom, flat screen TV. It is off the beaten path (appx 10 mins from strip) but for $59 per night you can't beat it. Beautiful view of gold course with floor to ceiling windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: al_d555
Reviews.Content: The suncoast is a small hotel/casino located about 15 minutes off the strip. It's more of a "locals" place which just means that it is smaller and friendlier. The room was large with basic decor, and the bathroom was quite large with great water pressure in the shower. Not much of a view, it's worth the few extra dollars to get a golf view

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: Onefather
Reviews.Content: I really mean it and I thank God thatr Suncoast is providing so great and devoted services to it's customers. My wife and myself and a friend that joined experience really great service and caring attention from the employees and managers there. Hey, and the slots were fun and loose. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: suzyqNorthernCa_
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. My room was very roomy, clean and attractive. It was nice and quiet, no traffic sounds, the hallways and rooms seem to be well insulated, heard almost no sounds from either. The only thing I didn't really enjoy was the buffet. It appeared that they really tried to economize on the limited number of choices, mediocre at best. Next time I would dine elsewhere. TGIFS was a little better but the portions are very small and the prices spendy. A long ways from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most fun and enjoyable places to stay in Las Vegas is The Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: tangirlkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite that was very clean and accomodated us with all our needs. Very quiet and relaxing. The casino and employees were wonderful. Loved the bowling ally and movie theatre. The buffet was AWESOME!!! We ate there every morning. Also the Italian Resturant was wonderful. Atmosphere, food and service was the best!!! Loved the location being away from the so busy and crowed strip but having the free shuttle was nice. My favorite thing was all the friendly staff and employees that acted like they had known us forever. Guess my least favorite thing would be not being able to stay longer. We will definitely be back to stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Eustorgio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast for a week of vacation and were entirely happy with our choice. Check-in was easy, and elevator access to the rooms was easy and convenient all week long. We got a room on the 6th floor with a view of the casino roof and satellite dishes. This was uninspiring, but the room was spacious, as was the bathroom, and everything worked. The room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. I'd give the staff high marks for friendliness. The casino was decent, and we enjoyed the bowling alley too. There were plenty of food choices, which we found satisfactory except for Fridays, where service was poor. The Suncoast is about 10 miles from the Strip and convenient to Red Rock Canyon. That suited us fine. We left satisfied with our experience and convinced we'd received exceptional value for what we paid. We'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: floridagrammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed a whole week over the Thanksgiving Holiday and loved every minute of it. Our room was the cleanest and freshest of any hotel we have stayed in. The sheets very comfortable and a choice of pillows, either soft or firm. The view was not the greatest, but we didn't spend too much time looking out the window. Each morning we enjoyed the breakfat buffet and gathered round the craps table ($3.00 minimum, great) before it got too crowded. At first, we complained to each other that the slots were too tight, but our last night there and the morning we left, we both won. The staff is so friendly and helpful so you don't mind asking dumb questions. The room was so big, when we arrived, my husband asked me if I booked a suite. The location was convenient for us because our daughter and family live close by and we were able to forego a rental car. We took the shuttle to the strip one day and that was hassle-free. Life is good at the Suncoast Hotel and Casino.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here, and would go again anytime.”
Reviews.Author: potejam
Reviews.Content: We are budget travelers who love a good deal. This was a very affordable price for us ($50 for a weekend was the cheapest decent place we found in Vegas through an online search). But despite the lowest price tag, we were very impressed. The rooms are fantastic, extremely spacious, and gave us the impression we were paying much more money (I even double checked later with the cashier!). Their website said their rooms have floor to ceiling windows, though we weren't expecting much. But they were right; the entire side is all window! Sure we didn't have the greatest view, but it made for a VERY bright room. We aren't big gamblers, so we can't comment on the games, but everything seemed to be available. They have an enormous sports betting lounge, and even a bowling alley. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly, from the clerk who gave us a couple free drink and food coupons to the cocktail waitresses. One thing to note: we may have just had a good night, but the drink service was BY FAR the quickest we have had in recent times. Very impressive! This casino is NOT on the strip, but they do offer shuttle services to and from, so if you want to spend just an evening there like we did, it's perfect. Cons are the confusing location of the elevator and the fact that registration is right in the heart of the casino. But that is only an issue when you first arrive and bring your bags in. After you know where everything is, that location is convenient. All in all, it's great value that will leave you thinking you'd just spent more.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for its purpose”
Reviews.Author: scoot5743
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my dad at this hotel. Really it is perfect if you don't feel the need to be at the strip everyday. I went there to gamble and relax. The limits are usually smaller then if you were to play on the strip. Lots of Video Poker for a nickel if you wanted. They also had craps for $3.00 minimum during the day. They do offer a courtesy shuttle that will take you to the strip. It takes you to the Tropicana if you want to hang out at the strip, and it will also take you to the airport. Rooms are adequate. Food is priced fairly and workers are very nice. The only thing I didn't like was the pool. Although the pool itself was fine, the way it is set up is that the sun doesn't hit the pool area until afternoon time. There were a couple of days I went out early and was freezing so I would hang out in the whirlpool to warm myself up. Really overall I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsgambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast for 3 nights last week & it was a delightful place to stay. Our room was on the 7th floor overlooking the golf course & a beautiful view. In fact we were in a mini suite & it was a lovely room, The bed was very comfortable. We only ate at the buffet but the food was very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that really does not want to stay on the strip as it is quite a ways from it. The casino is very comfortable & one thing we enjoyed it is not a smoke pit like some casino's are. We enjoyed playing there as well. We plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but sun.....”
Reviews.Author: Travelaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas at the end of October for a quick getaway before heading on to Zion and Bryce National Parks. All in all, the Suncoast met all of our needs. We liked being off the strip. The rooms are exceptionally nice with huge glass windows overlooking the golf course. The low key casino was great for us as we are not big gamblers. The buffet breakfast was inexpensive and had excellent food. There was only one problem with the hotel. The location of the swimming pool during the fall season results in a serious shortage of sunshine as it is located behind the resort and is blocked by it when the sun is low. It is in the shadows until later in the afternoon. We had beautiful weather but could not lay out by the pool. It is something I wish I would have known before we booked. Just to note, my husband went to the Suncoast during the summer previously and enjoyed ample sunshine at the pool during the day so it appears to be just a seasonal issue. That being said, it is still a great place with friendly people and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chelsea341
Reviews.Content: After visiting the Suncoast last year for dinner and a bit of gambling while visiting friends in Summerlin, we decided to stay here for two weeknights in September as part of a West Coast trip. It was very convenient for what we wanted as neither of us are big gamblers and were not interested in being on the Strip since were were not there for entertainment or shopping. The room were big and clean with a comfortable king size bed. Included in the rate of $55 was a breakfast and dinner buffet. Breakfast was pretty good with numerous choices; we did not have a chance to take advantage of the dinner but did have late night drinks and appetizers at the TGI Fridays there at the happy hour rate. There is a nice pool with a grassy lounging area, however, the sun does not appear on that side of the building until mid afternoon so it was a bit cool until then. There is also a outdoor hot tub up the stairs from the pool area which felt good after the pool. Staff were pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suncoast”
Reviews.Author: sylvano7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in september, really loved this hotel, about 10 miles from the vegas strip, but would sooner be in this area then the strip, it's quite small compared to those big strip hotels, but that suited us better, the staff are very friendly, and the rooms are lovely and spacious, the pool area is small but never overcrowded. The area is very nice with plenty of shops & restuarants nearby. The casino is small & friendly other reviews comment about the smoke in the casino but we didn,t find it that bad & we are non smokers. Check in was a breeze & to get a box of chocolates each, I thought that was a lovely touch. I would certainly choose this hotel again if we were ever in the vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Casino in Summerlin”
Reviews.Author: SalvatorFest
Reviews.Content: The Sun Coast is the host hotel for the USTA Women's 4.0 Nationals tennis championships in Las Vegas. I would not recommend this hotel for the following reasons: Pool doesn't get sun until 5 PM. "High End" Steak House on site has really mediocre food. Smoke in the casino- which you have to walk through to reach the elevator to the hotel rooms- is ridiculous. Sun Coast really needs to update their rooms and the ventilation system in the Hotel. If my team ever makes it to Nationals again, I will strongly advocate staying at the Marriott located directly across the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but casino environment”
Reviews.Author: Cactuslvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suncoast to see friends who lived nearby. I have two school aged children, and the casino part of the hotel was unavoidable because it is located on the first floor. The rooms were clean and relatively large with a spacious bathroom. I was worried that our non-smoking room would smell of cigarette smoke but it did not. In-house restaurants okay but pricey. The pool was nice for the kids to go out for a swim but there is no shade.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the hectic Strip”
Reviews.Author: WilboWaagins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast for 3 nights in September and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is off the beaten track (about 15 minutes drive to all the major action) but offers a slightly more sedate alternative to the Strip or downtown Las Vegas. The rooms are huge, as are the beds and are immaculately clean and comfortable. I’m not much of a gambler so the Casino’s abundance of 1 cent machines was of great appeal! On check in we were given complimentary chocolates and a BOGOF voucher for drinks at the onsite TGI Fridays which was a nice touch. The hotel has all the usual Vegas style facilities; cinema, bowling alley, pool etc. I didn’t sample any of the nightly entertainment in the show longue but from the posters it seemed to be of the pretty cheesy variety. The Suncoast is nothing overly special or spectacular (particularly in the ‘Vegas’ scheme of things) but it does offer great value and comfort at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: MIKE-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed off the strip to avoid the party weekend. The hotel was nice and clean. We had the 2 bedroom penthouse and it was nice and clean. The casino was nice but could use more table games. I like let-it-ride and 4 card poker and more of those types of games. The only other thing other than blackjack was 3 card poker. The pool is very small with a very small hot tub. I would feel wierd if another guy was in it and I went in. Its that small. Would never stay again but will gamble there. If clean is what your looking for its very clean. That says a lot because Vegas is going down hill quick as far as hotels being clean. We left southpoint because of bugs and we weren't happy with the 2 bedroom penthose at the mirage. Mirage was a shocker how dirty the room looked. The best thing I can say the casino is nice and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Want to stay off the Strip?”
Reviews.Author: EmEs
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of the hustle & bustle of staying on the strip, along with the heat and the crowds, try the Suncoast in Summerlin. It is an upscale neighborhood about 20 minutes northwest of the strip. Rooms were huge and clean, with everything one could want. It's not a high roller or high class kind of place, but it has loads of penny slots; perfect for fun. The added daily tax is only $5, as opposed to $15 at other resorts like the Red Rock. Food is fresh and good at the daily breakfast buffet. You can't beat the $7 price either. Just 45 minutes north is beautiful Mount Charleston, for a cool alternative to gambling. Also, the Red Rock Canyon is 20 minutes to the west for another outdoor adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and value for money”
Reviews.Author: eavesm
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic, great hotel with fantastic amenities on site. All staff where extremely helpful and the pool facilities and view was superb. My only fault would be the lack of friendlyness and organisation of the Poker Room, someone needs to have a serious looking into how it is runand improve greatly.

Reviews.Title: “A late review”
Reviews.Author: kori
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in December and really enjoyed it. We had a king-bed room and it was very large, and very clean. The bathroom area was nice also. The view from the room is outstanding. We did not notice the smell of smoking in the hallways - maybe our floor was non-smoking. The lady at the check-in was very helpful - no complaint there. There is some smell of smoke in the casino. But I would expect this, after all the whole casino is a smoking area. But the air is definately better than in the older places on the Strip or in Downtown casinos. It's a great place to stay if you want to play golf and there is also a shopping center (Boca Park) close by.

Reviews.Title: “If it was a little cheaper, it would be amazing”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this place is much better than average. The rooms and bathrooms are fantastic. Really big, and nice quality. I had a great view of the adjacent golf course. This place is in the middle of the golf resort community in Vegas. So it's in a great neighborhood, but It's a good drive to the strip. Food options are excellent, with a great, reasonably-priced buffet and a T.G.I.Friday's among other things. I got a $20 food credit when I checked in. The pool is not over the top, but still has a Roman feel to it, with majestic stairs leading to it. You get a free pass to the very good gym. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location to near my family”
Reviews.Author: Girlfriend2u
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because it's with 5 miles of my parents house in Sumerlin. The location is also excellent because it's with a mile or 2 of Red Rock Hotel and Casino. However, there was no need for me to go to Red Rock because I found everything I needed at Suncoast. I thought the rooms were clean, and the casino was clean. They also offered shuttle service, but only twice a day. So I got into the airport, and had to wait over an hour, because they have set times. I did call ahead and requested pickup service. Also on my return flight, I was there 3 hours early, because again of the set times of the shuttle. That was the only down fall. I think they should schedule it based on arrival times of those requesting service ahead of time. Maybe they do? Because the return back to the airport was a full shuttle! Also, I thought the restaurants were very good too.. I enjoyed my stay and will stay again as long as the rooms remain clean!

Reviews.Title: “We needed a place to stay while looking for a home.”
Reviews.Author: littlejoyce7
Reviews.Content: Would I stay here agian You bet I would. We had a poor start. Problem getting our valets attention. No baggage person was there. We wanted a smoking room and got a non smoking room. HOWEVER! The next day everything was made right. I can't say enough good things about the staff. I am very picky and the room was CLEAN and the beds wow very nice. Amanda and Amy where our valet's the next morn. What team work everyone should have a team like these two. Gambling there was nice , every night we won as much as we lost. Great location if you need a place while house hunting, in the northwest. By the way we did get a house: ) Price was great we got a 2 for 1 deal. I forgot the view was to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Older Review, but may prove helpful”
Reviews.Author: rakitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel/casino for the location and the ample room size. We were not coming to Vegas to gamble or enjoy this hotel for the casino purposes; we used it meerly for accommodations. The regular rooms are a good size well over 400 sq. feet and a good price for Vegas. This hotel/casino is off the strip and closer to Red Rocks. If you want to go downtown it is a short drive with your rental. Suncoast does provide shuttle service downtown and back as well. We chose this due to our rock climbing event at Red Rocks Redezvous. If you are going hiking, climbing, or in for the outdoor adventure... you may want to check this place out. We loved the size of the room. The beds were very comfortable, the bathrooms were a great size (double sink if I remember correctly), the pool was nice, and the staff were very accommodating. The staff even kept a straight face when we would leave every morning walking through the casino packs and gear slung on our backs... only to return filthy and wore out at night! We loved that they treated us just as they would their high limit players. If you are going to gamble... The rating system the casino uses is pretty tight and you will not build up comps quickly. The high limit slots are not quite as expansive or desireable as other places. We liked the poker room, and it seemed to have a good bunch of players all thorough the day. If you stay at this hotel (more than likely) you will run into an older crowd. It is not the place to be and be seen. The shows are good and they do their best to book name acts. If you are looking for a nice, friendly, family, inexpensive place to stay, you would do well to stay here. We had a great view of Red Rocks and a beautiful golf course. I think the golf course is top notch also. They have a movie theatre, an arcade, and a bowling alley in the hotel. I think it is also near the outlet malls. The only drawback was in the "regular rooms", they did not have a coffee maker or fridge... and remember...it is a casino...so if you are not "playing" you are "paying" for drinks, coffee, and even soda. The deluxe rooms now have a fridge and etc. I would recommend this place to others and would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip - Great Views-Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: FD214
Reviews.Content: Very large guest rooms, Had a view of the Red Rock Mountains and adj. Golf Course. The decor in the rooms was a little dated, but still comfortable. Flat Screen TV & Fridge in room, Fairly large bathroom as well. Stayed only one night, and it was a comfortable stay. Note - Hotel is off the strip - In a Very Nice neighborhood (Summerlin), about 15-20 min's or so from the main part of Las Vegas Blvd, Hotel does offer shuttle service to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for value”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticScot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, off the strip but courtesy bus every few hours takes you in. Went in to the strip each day and most evenings, very pleased we stayed off strip as not sure we would have slept too well there- can be noisy! If we had to do it again would probably stay on the strip for a couple of nights then go back to the Suncoast - mainly because the courtesy bus times do not fit in too well with having a meal and going to a show, taxis quite expensive (unless we were unlucky and picked a rip off merchant). Rooms large & comfortable, smallish casino, enjoyed the food, breakfasts not included but very reasonable prices and very good. Nice pool area, pool itself modest in size. Las Vegas - what can I say - we loved it - totally over the top. Was sad Star Trek in Hilton closed down now (gives away my age I guess), Bellagio, Little Venice, New York New York etc all well worth seeing. Stratosphere rides look terrifying but area it is in seems a bit downmarket and seedy. On the strip itself do not acknowledge the people smacking cards in their hands unless you want a referral to a 'working lady' - even though you see cars going around with billboards for the same - apparently prostitution is legal in parts of Nevada - but not Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting facility”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: I stayed her while coordinating a class in one of the hotel's meeting rooms. As the meeting planner, I was upgraded to a wonderful room on the 10th floor. It had a bar, living room, dining area, large separate bedroom and a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and a huge shower. The bed was very comfortable. The meeting facility is very well run, and worth consideration if you have an event. While there is a large selection of restaurants in the casino, I only patronized two: The Cafe Sienna served up a decent, inexpensive early bird breakfast special. The Bagel Cafe Express has pretty good sandwiches, although they seemed a bit pricey. Otherwise, I preferred to get out and eat somewhere else. Across the street are a Cheesecake Factory and a Gordon Biersch Brewpub that are both great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingGypsies
Reviews.Content: Two of the reviews listed when we booked were very critical about everything -- the food, the casino, trash in hallways, hard beds, etc. I was hesitant to make a reservation but the price was such a bargain and we were only going to be there there for two days. I'm so glad I did! We thought everything was superb. Our standard room was beautiful, and the bathroom was to die for. Two sinks, a separate tub/toilet room with a phone, no less. We had coffee in the morning, a newspaper at our door, a safe for our valuables and all for a special price of $30 per night (Mon and Tues). It was easily a $125 - $150 per night room. Very clean and fresh smelling. The beds were firm and the pillows were foam, but we happened to like that. We have eaten at the Casino Buffets all over town (we spend the winter here) and we think Sun Coast's is the best of the lot. We hope you will enjoy your stay as much as we did ours. We will definitely return soon.

Reviews.Title: “clean,good value for money”
Reviews.Author: richie5817
Reviews.Content: booked 2 king rooms week before we went....(had already booked trip with flights before) just needed a one night stay somewhere...... rooms large,getting a little old but very clean,breakfast buffet very good value at $6.95 each,coffee,tea,fruit juices etc included... bowling alleys good fun good for a one night stay,little too far out from the strip but for only $20 per room,(and resort fare of $5)..very good value

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast has everything right there”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shopped for cheap hotels west of the strip to visit my father. We found a bargain at Suncoast! $ Saving Tip: Visit suncoastcasino.com directly for last minute pricing if you are booking less than a month in advance--we saved 30% off of online booking agents' prices (hotline.com, lasvegas.com). Of course, I don't know if they always offer last-minute bargains, so you should still compare prices. The place is a long way from the strip and downtown. They do have a shuttle, but I opted for a rental car as we had family to visit in the area. The free self-park requires a walk through the casino; they have an inexpensive valet service that we used the final day. I was surprised how self-sufficient the hotel is. It has a bowling alley, movie theater, several dining establishments, coffee house, slots, large sports book, table games, a poker room, pool, spa, and an evening show for (at the time) $25. The restaraunts were all affordable; although the food was nothing to write home about. The service staff were more typical of a roadhouse grill than a polished spot on the strip. They were pleasant but don't expect them to bow to your every whim. Room service pricing was reasonable--not a rip off. I spent one fun weeknight playing 1/2 NL Hold'em, ordering free shots of Patron, and gabbing with a bunch of locals at the table. It was much more casual than the nail-biting poker on the strip. We finally called it quits at 9am! The room was large and clean. it wasn't a suite--just a wide room. We had enough floor space in the middle to do aerobics! For those with kids, plenty of space for a rollaway or two. The size of the TV was disappointing (24 inch?). It has a good sized bath and plenty of closet and drawer space. It think this would be a great family destination or a good change-of-pace from the glitz of the strip. I would describe Suncoast as a hometown experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, A little Old but Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EMAWEST
Reviews.Content: We were driving to St George, Utah and back from Los Angeles to deal with some estate issues of my husband's late mother, so were not in Vegas to gamble at all, just wanted somewhere that was clean and pleasant and that had a gym and pool. Suncoast fit the bill perfectly, the hallways and casino were rather smoky but not the room. It was huge nearly as big as our Manhattan apartment it was at least 500 sq ft., beautiful floor to ceiling windows , couch, table and a desk, more like a junior suite. Far from the strip, if that is what you come to Vegas for then this would not be a good bet for you, but if you are here for business or family then go right ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place off of strip”
Reviews.Author: BCAdventurerer
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here. Great value, beautiful views. Decor is dated but clean and in great condition. Rooms are very large.Price is right. All staff are friendly and polite. Many ammenities in the hotel ie movie theatre, bowling, wide variety of restaurants. Could use more then one doorman as he was very overworked. We have stayed at the Red Rock and found the value and size of the rooms much better at the Suncoast. In response to a previously negative review we did have an alarm clock in the room. If you are not able to set the clock yourself I am sure any of the friendly staff would have tried to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but not great for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Suncoast while on business in Las Vegas. The hotel is located in Summerlin, about 20 minutes from the Strip. My room was large and well maintained. It had a great view of the valley. I had read quite a few complaints about the beds at this hotel but I found that, while it was very firm, my bed was comfortable. As reported, there is no choice of pillows. There was a large plasma TV in the room as well as a refrigerator. TV channel selection was very limited. The bathroom was large with great water pressure. Housekeeping kept my room is good shape. The casino is the focal point of the hotel. You have to drag your luggage through it to get to the elevator, which I find very inconvenient. It was also very smokey, so much so that I could only stand it for short periods of time. There are several restaurants in the facility. I had dinner in both Salvatore's and SC Prime and both were good but not great. Since I was traveling for business, I left the hotel fairly early. I found that breakfast was a problem. The buffet did not open until 8 a.m. and the bagel cafe didn't open until 8:30 a.m. This left a small coffee shop in the lobby that served a small selection of pastry. A muffin and OJ was about $7. If you need the internet, plan on spending an additional $13 per day. If you're looking for an "off strip" hotel for a reasonable price and you want to gamble, this may be a good option. If you need business services (like breakfast in the morning) and want to be close to Las Vegas attractions, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Sucks”
Reviews.Author: heyheyColorado
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was awful. The first problem I had was when I arrived at my room. I had requested a king and got 2 double beds. I called from that room and was told that I was mistaken and that I had requested 2 double beds. Definitely not the case and so much for the customer being right. I then had to schlep my bag all the way back to reception to exchange the key for another room. No, they couldn't meet me at the new room or even meet me half way for that matter. No apologies were given for the inconvenience. If you plan on reading in your room better bring a flashlight. The lights are so dim that it's impossible to read. While you're at it, bring your own pillow too. The pillows are so huge that you almost sleep sitting up. As for a blanket in the room, there aren't any. You have to ask them to bring you one. During my 3 night stay there, there were always room-service trays left in the hall on the floor and most of them had food in them. 24 hours later the same trays were still there. Come on, can't room service go back and pick up the tray? How about housekeeping - can't they pick it up? It was disgusting. The grand finale though was when they left a letter stating that the electricity would be off sometime during the middle of the night. They neglected to also include that the ear peircing fire alarm would also sound off in addition to being without power. Once again, no apology from the hotel and it wasn't an accident either. They knew the alarm was going to go off but neglected to put that in the letter for fear you would find another hotel. The front desk explained it off as it had to be done and there was just no good time to do it. Really? How about any time other than the middle of the night?? I complained to the people at the seminar I attended as they had arranged this hotel. They got the hotel to issue a whopping $15.00 in food vouchers (only good at certain places in the hotel) for the inconvenience. Again there was no letter of apology with the coupon, just the coupon itself in an envelope that I had to retrieve from the front desk. Guess it was again too much trouble to slip under my door. If you didn't have a battery operated alarm clock and needed to get up in the morning, you were in trouble. Did I mention that housekeeping never bothered to set the clock again after the power was off? The blinking clock flashed the wrong time for the remainder of the stay. Best advice, run don't walk from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: dayglopixie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice and while the rooms are excellent, the service is terrible. The first time we stayed there was my wedding night, we got married in vegas and we needed somewhere to stay before we left on our honeymoon. We went to the valet, and they left me standing in the middle of traffic in my wedding dress. No one ever came to pick up our bags. I had to carry my own to the room in my wedding dress. The second time we stayed there, we were woken at 6 a.m. to construction right outside our window. When we complained, the front desk told me that I should have known that there was going to be construcion noises. He was so rude I am still upset six months later!

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan. Hope I never have to go back”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: This is a "locals" hotel, and it shows. The whole hotel is very smoky and smelly. The food areas are low brow and not upscale at all. The casino is very very smoky and a lot of slot machines. It is about $70 from the airport here in a cab. The rooms are large and the bathrooms look like they have been remodeled recently. The hallways, even on the non-smoking floors, are smelly. The rooms oddly (and thankfully) are not. I guess if you're staying here to escape your local family it would be fine but there is no way that I would ever stay here instead of staying somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place away from the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Thompson_Ct_Ekim15
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week here.Room was big not tripping over things.Bed was fine. Nice big bath area. Pool kinda small but never very busy. Very nice casino lots of games and a lot of video poker machines.Only ate at the buffet but found it to be a very good value. Ice cream place very good. Great value hotel away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Away From The Strip”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBrit
Reviews.Content: Set in a pleasant residential area of west Las Vegas, the Suncoast is a well-kept hotel/casino catering to frequent Las Vegas visitors who have tired of the endless traffic and construction noise of The Strip. (The Bellagio, for example, seems to be surrounded by sprouting high-rises topped by giant cranes.) The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, with wall-to-wall, floor- to-ceiling windows. Request the golf course side and you will be rewarded with a panoramic view of the greens, as well as the small pool area of the hotel. Though our room was beginning to show some signs of use (stains on sofa and chair), it was kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff. The Suncoast also provides visitors with movie theatres and a bowling alley - but, disappointingly, no spa. Parking is plentiful and the lot well lit. There is a shuttle bus to the Orleans and the Gold Coast. I'm not sure about the other Boyd properties. The players cards are being updated to include all of the Boyd casinos which include the above as well as the California, Sam's Town and Main Street.
