Though we qualified for the casino rate, this was still high compared to other Coast hotels. The Suncoast does have seasonal specials which are good value and worth signing up for their e-mails. Across the street from the Suncoast is a brand new, low-rise, mega- shopping center complete with upscale stores and restaurants. The Red Rock Casino is just a short drive away. We can recommend the buffet, with a good selection of freshly prepared food. The breakfast buffet was provided with our room. The casino and hotel staff were pleasant and courteous. Beverage service was prompt. We would recommend the Suncoast to those who have "done" the strip and are not afraid to drive around Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad beds!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger54
Reviews.Content: A friend & I were going out to Las Vegas for a long weekend in August. We wanted to stay in the Summerlin area because we were attending a friend's party, and our friend did not live too far from the Suncoast. I was a little hesitant to stay at the Suncoast due to some of the previous reviews on Trip Advisor regarding the bad beds & poor pillows. The friend that I was going with and I discussed it and we decided to give the Suncoast a try anyways. I mean, how bad could a bed be, right? A couple of weeks before our trip I called the Suncoast & spoke to the hotel manager regarding my concerns about the hotel's beds. She assured me that the mattresses had all been replaced about 1.5 years ago and that the pillows were fine. After speaking with her, I felt better & decided to stay there. I think the manager must have put a note in my reservation, because when I checked in to the Suncoast I got upgraded to the most amazing 1700 sq foot suite, a Tuscany Suite. This Suite was fabulous - foyer with 1/2 bath, separating a huge living room and a good sized bedroom with absolutely the biggest jacuzzi bathtub I have ever seen in my life! Floor to ceiling windows in all rooms of the suite, a walk in shower big enough for 6 people and a beautiful looking bed. I don't mean to harp on the bed but a good night's sleep is very important to me, and a comfortable mattress & feather (or at least fluffy) pillows are quite necessary. Well, sorry to say, the reviewers were right and I had the 3 worst nights of sleep in any hotel I have ever stayed in. The bed was SO uncomfortable that I woke up every morning with a very sore back. It was so bad that I could have used a chiropractor! The pillows were horrible foam rubber ones and not a feather pillow was to be found in the entire hotel. One would think that especially a suite would have the most comfortable bed imaginable and scads of feather pillows. Sorry folks -not at the Suncoast!! I was also very surprised that the suite didn't offer more "treats" such as slippers, bathrobes, upgraded bath amenities, bottled water or anything. During my 3-night stay things that got used (pads of paper, shampoo, etc) were not replaced. My friend stayed in a regular room and the beds & pillows were the same as in the suite. The standard rooms were beautiful - very spacious & comfortable with a couch & coffee table, and a separate double sink area from the shower & toilet area. The staff were very friendly & accommodating, The casino wasn't lucky for me but I just go to have fun & play the penny slots. The hotel and casino itself were very nice and the Bagel Cafe Express has the best everything bagels I've ever tasted, but until I know that the hotel has improved on their bedding I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kalispunk19
Reviews.Content: This hotel really offers some amazing value. (There is a free shuttle to/from the strip and airport, but a car is really a must.) Our room felt luxurious given the size and view of the mountains, golf course, and pool area. Good variety of food for reasonable prices, and even had $1 bowling after midnight. They even have penny video poker and blackjack, though those machines tend to fill up fast. Only downside: the pool was oddly shaped and only 4 feet deep.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mee2007
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for someone who doesn't want to deal with the hussle of the strip. The rooms are huge and the view is amazing. Not much of a selection when it comes to room service, but the hotel is located in Summerlin and is surrounded by restaurants, grocery stores, and only a few minutes drive from the red rock mountains. The area, unlike the strip, is very safe and is a great place for families to stay. The only drawback is walking through the casino and trying to find the elevators, but this is the case in all Vegas hotels. Every time I stay here the room rate has been under $50, which is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service Superior to The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: trucks1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in an Executive One Bedroom Suite & would stay again. The golf course view is fabulous & the space is a welcome change from a hotel room. In addition, every staff person we encountered was friendly & accommodating. Their room service is far superior to The Palazzo (we stayed here the previous 4 nights) - prompt, our order was correct w/all necessary cutlery, friendly, & professional. Only criticism is the smokiness of the casino. I can't believe w/present technology the stale tobacco odor cannot be corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsthing43Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and for the price it met far behine my expectation. Every thing is there for you right in this hotel. I love this hotel and I will be booking there again on my next trip to Las Vegas. They rooms are big and very clean. This hotel is great for a family trip,so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: JKHart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while visiting family. The room was HUGE and the floor to ceiling window overlooked a golf course. Everything was very clean. We were shocked that we only had to pay $42 a night to stay here! The front desk staff were very friendly...even at 1:30 am when we were finally checking in. We were given no trouble about our request for 2 queen beds in a non-smoking room. The valet service was quick and easy. The only thing we did not like was having to walk through the smoky casino with our 5 month old to get to the elevators. Highly reccommended hotel if you are looking to be quite a ways off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the SunCoast!!”
Reviews.Author: TC-PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SunCoast for a 6 day stay from Late May to Early June. We usually stay off strip as we have a rental car and valet park when we do things on the strip. Check-In was quick and efficient, they ensured that we knew where everything was. Bellman and Valet service were outstanding for the duration of the trip. Service at the Cafe and the Buffet was great. We were asked by virtually every employee we came in contact with how we were enjoying our stay, very nice for a change. The pool was small, but we enjoyed it very much. Not too crowded and not a bunch of screaming kids, it was also open until 10:00 pm which is a plus if you want a late night dip. The room was spacious and nicely docorated. Very accuratey portrayed on the website. It also had a Frig which was nice to keep bottled water/soda in. The halls were quiet and the walls were thick, all the better to sleep in after long nights. The SunCoast is in a nice residential area with plenty of shopping nearby if you need to pick up last minute items. The drink service was quick while we played the slots. The slots were looser that many we experienced this trip. Overall we would highly recommended the SunCoast to anyone who does not need to stay on the Strip and is looking for a quieter, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad deal”
Reviews.Author: hogandoc
Reviews.Content: Fantastic deal on price; Room was enormous! Bathroom was elegant (both the 'sink' room and the 'shower/tub' room). View was underwhelming though. Restaurants not bad, they have a Seattle's best coffee and an ice cream parlor right off the casino; LONG walk from self-park garage to check-in to your room, plan for a walk (through the crowded casino) with your luggage. Or you could splurge with valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Sun is Shining at Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: Over the past year, I have visited Las Vegas on business 6 times and this is the first time I have stayed so far off the strip. Suncoast was chosen because of the really low rate and because of its location sort of near our business location. I didn't miss the strip because Suncoast offered all the gambling temptations, as did at the neighboring Rampart Casino. Plus, the hotel movie theatre, bowling alley and nice selection of surrounding shopping and restaurants in this upscale area (Summerlin) provided more than what I needed for my 4 day stay. Staff: exceptionally nice. Check in was great. They couldn't give me the king bed I reserved, but they guaranteed the nonsmoking room which was a must. Housekeeping crew were friendly and all the restaurant and shop staff were great. Room: large and spacious, including the huge bathroom. Nice flat screen tv, but limited channel selection. Bed was the most disappointing of all. Mattress caused me to be pretty stiff and pillows were so-so. Room temperature was easily controllable--a huge plus for me. Car/parking: Having a car for this location is essential. I found that parking it in the outside lot (not the parking garage) offered quicker, easier room access. Gaming: Roulette offers 50 cent chips w/$2.00 minimum inside bets. You don't see that in too many places anymore. I hope to stay here again but I wish they'd upgrade their mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ready-to-retire59
Reviews.Content: We and several couples stayed at the Suncoast Hotel for four nights in mid-April when our son was getting married at the Stratosphere. We picked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were surprised you had to walk through the casino to get to your room, but that seems pretty standard in Vegas. Our rooms were large and exceptionally quiet, (though not on the golf course view side), the pool was beautiful (and not crowded), and we loved being away from the Strip. Our requests to stay on the same floor with family and friends were honored, and when my sister-in-law's room's hair dryer caught on fire, it was replaced within the hour. One of our family members stayed at Treasure Island through a Costco package deal (airfare, car, hotel), and it was definitely cheaper, but it is on the Strip. We had no complaints about the staff or service at this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sula8225
Reviews.Content: my husband and i originally had planned to stay down on the strip. but my parents just moved to summerlin, so the suncoast was alot closer, and the price was very reasonable. upon check in, we encountered our first proble. when we made the reservation, it was for a king smoking. when we checked in, the girl at the desk, told us sorry, we only have a queen room smoking. i told her i was unhappy as we paid for a king room. she was kinda rude, and told me that suncoast's policy, is that they don't have to guarantee the type of room you pay for, they only have to provide you with a bed. i asked her why they even ask you which type of room you want, if they aren't going to honor it? she said that's our policy, sorry. let's just say, i was pretty irritated, and then when i asked to speak to a manager she told me there wasn't one on duty, and there wouldn't be until noon of the next day. that meant there was no one on duty for 15 hours that could make any customer service decisions, which i found to be joke! we were so exhuasted, so i just said whatever, give us our room. the room, except for it being the wrong bed, was actually quite nice. it was very roomy, and we had the view of the strip way off in the distance. the bathroom was huge, with a double vanity area, and a gigantic shower, which was big enough for both me and my husband to shower in at the same time. the tv, was a flat screen tv that must have been at leat 50-55 inches, but the channel selection was terrible. we got about 2 espn channels, tbs and tnt, and some local betting channels, that's it!!! no movie channels, weather channel, nothing. i know we're on vacation and weren't expecting to watch alot of tv, but it would have been nice while getting ready for the night, or before bed. the beds, ugh, not very comfortable, and the pillows??? if you stay here you might as well be prepared to have a sore, stiff neck the whole time. the worst pillows i've ever felt. we actually had to go to wallmart to buy pillows, the ones they had were unbearable. the next morning we went to the front desk to find out when they would be able to move us to our king room, and again we were told there was still no manager there, and woldn't be for a few hours. i cannot believe there isn't a manager on duty at all times. who handles serious problems? halfway into our 2nd day there, a manager called our room, and said that he had a king room ready for us. by this point we had unpacked our stuff, and i was so irritated, i didn't want to spend my vacation, unpacking, then packing again, then moving everything on the complete opposite end of the hotel, then unpacking again, i came on vacation to relax. if this is suncoast's policy, does that mean that if people request a non smoking room, then they will put them in a smoking room, if that's all they have available? if that's the case, i would not recomment this hotel to anyone, i find that policy to be ridiculous, and misleading. the casino we found nice, lots of games, fairly clean, always employees, picking up bottles, and cups, and emptying ashtrays at all the slots. there were several food choices, however we only ate at the deli, and the 24 hour coffee shop. we also had coffee every morning at the Seattle's best coffe shop. i would liked to have a coffee machine in my room, like most other hotels, rather than spend $5.00 every morning for a gourmet coffee. the only other thing for the food, is that 3 out of the 4 nights there, after gambling we were hungry. we went to the 24 hour coffee shop the first night, and the service was the worst i've ever had at any restaurant, and i worked in the hospitality industry for 15 years. the waitress had no idea what she was doing, and it wasn't even that crowded. after it taking 1.5 hours for 2 appetizers and an entree to split, we decided we would eat out the remainder of the nights. the last 2 nights there we were really hungry in the early morning hours, and stopped by the same 24 hour restaurant, and asked to have order to go, in a box, because of how slow the service was last time. she told us no, they didn't have any take out silverware. so instead, we ordered room service, which was the same exact menu, but 4x the prices, and they bring you regular silverware. not really sure why they wouldn't just give us a roll of silverware, like they did when they delivered our $30 appetizer meal, ridiculous! we didn't use the pool or the gym, so can't comment on those, but the movies and the bowling alley looked very nice. the gift shop, was quite nice, had everything we needed and both ladies working in there were so nice and helpful. when it came time to check out, it was very easy, did it right on the tv. called down to the bellman and asked for a luggage cart, as we had 4 big bags. he told us it would be over an hour wait, so we had to make 2 trips down ourselves. all in all, the facility was very clean, including had sanitizer units on the walls. the customer service was pretty poor, which to me is a big reason people become repeat customers. not sure if we will stay here again, when we come out to visit our family, who live only 2 miles away. it seemed like the staff could have cared less about all the people who spent our hard earned cash to stay there, and i didn't care for that attitude at all

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jim738
Reviews.Content: On our way to visit Las Vegas relatives and national parks in Utah, we stayed at the Suncoast Casino and Hotel and found that it fit our needs perfectly. The facility is located some distance from both the airport and the "Strip", but is easy to get to by car. For a very, very modest price, our room was huge, clean, and had great views from the 8th floor. As in most Las vegas hotels, one enters by walking through the casino, which has, I believe, an area of 80,000 square feet or about an hectare. Various restaurants are scattered around the perimeter of the casino. The neighboring vicinity contains several golf courses and a large shopping mall. All is clean and shining brightly in the desert sun.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Paul_in_VA
Reviews.Content: I can only second what others have said here. Clean, crisp, sunny and well-maintained hotel. So as not to waste space, let me add something I rarely read in reviews: an overview of the area surrounding the hotel. Suncoast is not on or near the Strip. It's a good 7-10 miles from it but that's part of the appeal. The hotel is at the edge of a golf course and surrounded by upscale condos and single-family homes. It's very quiet--more like a resort community than a gambling one. Some rooms have views of the Strip in the distance (looks incredible at night), others have view of the golf course and the mountains and Red Rock Canyon (very nice to wake up to). Good breakfast deal: for the price of eggs and bacon in the casual dining restaurant off the casino floor (I forget its name), you can have the breakfast buffet. Many hot, fresh choices that border on brunch but also a very good yoghurt and cereal bar. I can't imagine staying on the Strip. Rent a car and have the freedom to play all you want and then go home for a good night's sleep in one of the best neighborhoods in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Shines”
Reviews.Author: tootalltraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference not vacation so the location and price was what I was looking for, not the casino nor relation to "the strip". Having said that, the hotel experience was great. We stayed 4 nights, Sat 23rd to Tues the 26th. The room, booked through i4vegas.com, averaged $75 a night. We had a very spacious king bed room with a spectacular view from the 3rd floor overlooking the north valley and mountains. A previous reviewer was looking for a non smoking floor and rooms. The 3rd floor is nonsmoking and once we got to the floor the smoke was not a problem. We didn't have time to take in all the ammenities, the pool and hot tub, bowling lanes, 16 screen movie theater, and several great restaurants. We did hit the ice cream store, coffee stand and we did eat at the buffet restaurant for Sunday brunch. All were great and the staff were all friendly and service oriented. The valet guys and gals also were friendly and earned every tip the got. We arrived at our room on our last day and a couple light bulbs were burned out so I caught a maintenance guy passing in the hall and within minutes he was back replacing bulbs. That's service. All in all a great stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Still a beautiful lady”
Reviews.Author: Sp0rty
Reviews.Content: Even though she has some years on her, this hotel is still a beautiful lady. The rooms are a really good size and very clean. Once again, we were given a room with the view of the roof but it was up high enough that we could see the mountains and the strip in the distance. The bathroom has a door between the shower and the sink so it accomodates two people at once. The beds were comfortable and our room had a couch that was nice to relax after a long day. We ate in the cafe, the buffet and the streakhouse and they were all very good. The staff of the hotel was wonderful. We were treated really well by everyone. The staff was not afraid to smile and went out of their way to be accomodating. We visit Las Vegas two or three times a year and I try a different hotel each time. This was one of my favorites and one that I would not mind trying again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: HOTGIRL4
Reviews.Content: I could not believe all of the amenities at this place. The room was spacious with a great view and flat screen tv. It is a ways away from the strip but they do provise a free shuttle service there and back as well as to the airport and back. After visiting the strip I was glad that we didn't stay on it. The major plus was the gaming, $5 tables, no where else in Vegas had it. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rosered78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast for a birthday weekend and had a great time! The hotel staff were fantastic and were always happy and willing to help us. We had a rental car that we drove to the strip so the location off Las Vegas Bldv. wasn't a problem. The only down side was that the shuttle to the strip only runs every hour and a half, and cabs need to be called, they don't just show up at the hotel like they do closer to the strip. Overall a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: apinney33
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something reasonable in Vegas for a night after a stay elsewhere wasn't so great. We booked the Suncoast through hotels.com and had a great experience. The hotel was wonderful, the staff friendly. They have lots more to do than just gamble, a theatre and a bowling alley. Room service was great! The food was still warm and tasted great. It's away from the strip, so if you really want to party hard, maybe not the place for you, but for a laid back trip, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: chanel77
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and 3 kids ages 1, 3, and 5. After our experience I just had to write a review. We initially had trouble with our booking through travelocity and I had to have multiple conversations with the staff of the hotel and everyone I dealt with was nice and accommodating. So before I began my trip I already had a good feeling. January 29th, 2008 is when we checked in and were we ever in for a treat. At the desk when we gave our names, the clerk spoke to her boss standing nearby to let her know that a new guest had arrived and I heard the woman say, "Give them the suite." We were registered for a one bedroom so you would not believe how excited we were when we reached the double doors that led into our room. We opened the door to the most beautiful 2 bedroom suite!! This entire place was floor to ceiling windows looking out on the most beautiful views of the mountains and golf courses. The room had tvs everywhere, in each bathroom (along with phones). The tubs were deep and large with jacuzzi jets and a water jet for your neck. The showers were large and the master bath even had multiple heads with a variety of settings. I had 2 nozzle continually oscillating back and forth and you could adjust their speed and intensity. The furnishings were beautiful, all the wood dark and attractive and there was a bar that sat 8 people. We could not have been more excited and we had booked for 50 dollars. I did not want to leave, it was just so beautiful, especially during the day staring out at the panoramic view. Some people want to stay on the strip, this place was wonderful and seriously not more than a 10 minute drive from the strip and they have a free shuttle to take you there and pick you up. The casino downstairs was a nice size and I played a little down there also. i was continually amazed at how everyone I dealt with from the check in clerk to the woman I purchased my bingo game from were just consistently nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Just so you know, I saw the regular one bedrooms being cleaned and they looked of the same quality, but only smaller. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel EXCELLENT Staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: CindyEnchanted
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last March and I have to say it is a really NICE place to stay! The staff are WONDERFUL and genuinely seem to care about what they do - I experienced nothing but pleasantness and professionalism while I was there. Its like the staff WANTED to be there and any request you had was no problem. ALL the staff from the front desk to the bartender make you feel like you MATTER there. I was VERY impressed at how professional and NICE everyone was while I stayed there. The rooms are AMAZING ! I have to mention the beds themselves - they were SO comfortable and the sheets were pure mmmmmmmmm!!! I have stayed in a lot of hotels but I have to say the beds in this particular hotel were AMAZING ! The sheets smelled CLEAN as well - that is a big thing to me. I plan on coming back this year and HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: nomadeast
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the suites for six nights in Dec of '07 and were pleasantly surprised by the size and amenities in the room - not what one would expect from a Summerlin hotel... more like a high-roller suite at a strip hotel with a nice view of the Strip off in the distance in one direction and Red Rocks in the other. Room and amenities were excellent with a very nicely appointed bathroom. Unfortunately, the shower head pressure was about a 5 out of 10. Restaurants were all of good quality - don't expect 3 star and you won't be disappointed. Like most of the off-strip properties, the entire staff was friendly and accommodating from the housekeepers to the dealers to the pit bosses and desk staff. As with most Vegas properties, the smoke in the casino is unbearable but, fortunately, it didn't make it up to the 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “The Suncoast is a Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: slynntaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an extended weekend. We paid $47 for Friday and Saturday night, and $25 for Sunday (yes, really.) The room was fantastic. It was very spacious, much larger than an average hotel room. The room had a large flat screen tv, was very clean, and the beds were quite comfortable. The view was beautiful. We looked down at the pool, golf course, and dessert mountains in the distance. (Request the pool side, because the other side views were not as nice.) The pool and pool area looked very nice, but we were unable to use, because it was too cold. Our room was non-smoking and it didn't even smell like smoke in the hallway. This was a big plus, considering the haze of smoke in the casino. The bowling alley and theater were also spacious and nice. If you want to stay off the strip, you can't beat this place. The drive to the strip was easy on the freeways and took only 10 minutes. As mentioned in other reviews, the restaurant prices were fair and the buffet was good. The best surprise was the prices in the hotel store. A six pack of beer was about $6. About the same you'd find in a grocery store. The other alcohol was similarly priced. Regarding the price we paid per night, after a rather exhaustive search, I booked on i4vegas.com. It had by far the best rates. The hotel was asking $144 for the nights we paid $47, on their website. So, shop around and give the Suncoast I try. I'm so glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: johnae91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from October 12-18th. Excellent location, away from the hustle and bustle of the strip traffic. Great eating places around, shopping for ones who like to shop. One the greatest bingo halls ever. I came her in April and won $46,080.00 playing bingo, came back this time and my husband won $1430.00 playing bingo and then won another $500.00 when they called his name on a raffle drawing. Rooms are to die for, absolutely beautiful, had a wonderful view of the city, mountains and golf course. Next door also in two other casinos to enjoy, and 5minutes away is the beautiful Red Rock Casino. The slots are also nice to play, did not win a lot, but stayed alive and did not lose my shirt. Will definitely be coming back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Day Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nancy714
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. They say its a "local" casino and I truly felt welcomed there. From the reception desk to housekeeping , it was a sheer delight. Very Clean and nice big rooms. Nice big screen TV on the wall. Close to everything ( only about 7 miles from the strip) The buffet was wonderful and the prices were more than affordable. If your over 50 and get your players card then you get your buffet discounted a few bucks. The dealers were very friendly and as for that matter all of the employees were more than cordial. There is a lot to see nearby but if you like Bingo and slots you are in for a treat. The slots are kinda generous and lots of fun ones to play as well. Although there are lots of people around there is not that loud noise that you hear in some casinos. And there is a 16 plex movies theater that we always said we would go to but we never did get arounf to it. We both played in a Texas Hold Em tournament and it was great even though neither of us won any money but we did come pretty close. Via Veneto was their Italian resturant and it was very good and certainly worth a try. Great prices and great italian food. There is so much more but suffice it to say both my husband and I loved it there. Check out their website. Nancy and Ted T.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Clrich56
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Suncoast was average compared to other hotels that I have stayed at in Vegas. I had booked a non-smoking room due to my allergies only to be told upon check in that they had no non-smoking rooms available and the front desk staff was unwilling to accommodate me other than allowing me to switch room 2 days into my stay. Since I was traveling for business and was sharing a rental car with others in my group relocating was not an option. To my surprise the smoking room was decently cleaned and didn't smell as much like smoke as I thought it would. Could have been because the casino was smoky as casinos typically are. There are several things to do at the Suncoast besides gamble. Such as bowling, movies and an arcade. The Mexican restaurant was pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an all-in-one.”
Reviews.Author: justMJ
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast is an all-in-one stay: Hotel, casino, restaurants, bowling alley, convenience store, and movie theater. The rooms themselves were nice, with reasonably comfortable beds, lots of space, nice bathrooms, and good cleanliness. I wasn't impressed with the restaurants except for the steakhouse, which was priced reasonably and produced an excellent meal. The casino itself is not extensive, and I didn't spend any time in there. If you have kids, be aware that the floor-waitress outfits are rather racy! My biggest complaint was the HIGH cost of in-room internet access. It was the most expensive I've come across yet ($17 a day!) Overall, everything about this hotel was average or above average. I wasn't overly impressed... but it definitely had about the lowest cost in the area, so it was worth it for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast-----GREAT value for the $ !”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesStu
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast gives you excellent value for a bargain price !Often you can get a wonderful room for $50 : spacious, clean, with a comfortable king size bed & a large sized flatscreen TV on the wall. Casino is fun, with fairly loose video poker machines. I have found the hotel staff to be usually uniformy pleasant, helpful & courteous. The only drawback I have about the place is while the buffet & Italian restaurants are pretty good, the 24 hour coffee shop is decidedly mediocre-----only a couple of menu items are worth ordering. Otherwise, a great value for the buck !

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at how lovely the rooms were!”
Reviews.Author: kimlh
Reviews.Content: We have family that lives near this hotel and have eaten at the cafe several times. We have always been pleased with the food and service in the cafe. On this trip we found ourselves in need a hotel room for 1 night. We choose the Suncoast because of the low price and close proximity to our family. When we arrived in the rooms I was so surprised at how lovely they were. They have possibly been remodeled recently. We had 2 rooms, one on the 3rd floor and one on the fourth floor. In comparision to most hotels the rooms were quite spacious. The rooms had large flat screen T.V's and granite countertops in the bathrooms. The bathroom was two rooms with the shower and toliet separate from the vanity and sink. The room included a iron and ironing board. On the downside no coffee maker in the room. Of the two rooms, the room facing the pool had very nice views and the room on the opposite side had a boring view. The website I booked the room through gave us free breakfast in the buffet. I'm glad it was free because it was not very good! I would not eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice.....”
Reviews.Author: flyingjay99
Reviews.Content: Suncoast is a mediocre hotel with shabby furnishings and unfriendly staff. The hotel room are a strange layout with old furnishings. While the housekeeping staff kept it clean, it did not feel like it. The front desk staff were not very helpful nor friendly. Most of the guests were over 65, which is a plus or minus depending on your viewpoint. Lastly, the hotel offers a hotel shuttle, but it only goes out two or three times a day, which is not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Casino/Terrible Management”
Reviews.Author: enjoyyourtravel
Reviews.Content: A nice clean casino with affordable restaurants. However, the service you get from the hosts and managers are nothing short of "Unacceaptable". Being one of the newest casino in Summerlin area does not give management the right to have a chip on their shoulder. Unlike other casinos who treat their guest as if they would want to be treated, the Suncoast management don't care if one has a pulse as long as one bring in revenue to their casinos. Their compensation for players is "Zero". You can be sitting there for 5 hours and end up with a $10 buffet voucher, which they will write it off on their expenses. I stop an executive host to ask a question about the table action and he purposely ignored me and walked away. I have been to this casino in the past and swear to my family and friends that I will never make the drive and step in this casino AGAIN. Suncoast management should understand that they are not the only casino in Vegas and they are not close to being the best. I would rate them bottom of the barrell. Suncoast management: Go back to the basics and treat customers well and they will come back for more action.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...What a find”
Reviews.Author: loomis41973
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Cant wait to return. Huge, clean rooms. Some of the nicest employes i have come across in Vegas. Drink service was great and the waitresses have some very sexy outfits. Numerous dining options with great graveyard specials. Gift shop sells liquor and is very reasonably priced. Suncoast was first class in every aspect of my stay from valet parking to checkout. If you are looking to stay off-strip, this place would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “We love staying at the Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_Alabama_Belle
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas once a year and have stayed at different hotels, but the last 4 years we have stayed at the Suncoast and we love it. The rooms are huge and the view is wonderful. It even has a big bathroom and you don't find that too often. We always ask for the mountain view and it overlooks the pool, golf course and the beautiful mountains. It is breath taking. The hotel is not that far from Red Rock Canyon. The hotel staff is very friendly. We have never had a problem there. They have great restaurants. Several to choose from. We love eating at the buffet or the Mexican restaurant. They are pretty reasonable. They have a 64 lane bowling alley and other areas for kids to enjoy. Most anything you need you will find there. If not there are nearby stores. They have a shuttle that will take you to and from the strip free of charge if you are a guest at the hotel so you won't have to bother driving there. They have plenty of good slots, tables and even bingo. They also have movie theaters. We feel very comfortable and safe when we stay there. They have plenty of security. You can't go up the elevators in the evening unless you show security your room key. When you check in they give you fun books and they have discounts in them. Like I said we love it and we are looking forward to our trip this year. We would highly reccommend this hotel if you like being away from the really busy districts like the strip. Larry & Sandra (from Mobile, AL)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: owlcoast
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Stayed in a huge suite at a good price. Hotel and room were very clean. Room was quiet, no noise from the hall or other rooms. Excellent service: valet, bellman, room service, front desk. Front desk had two cribs in our room before our arrival. At most hotels, we have to call two or three times after arrival to get cribs delivered, no matter how often we have requested them ahead of time. Only issue: pool was not heated as much as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nice area”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl702
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my Friend. We did a lot of shopping during the day and stayed in at the hotel during the night. We went bowling, watched movies and gambled at the hotel. The area Summerlin is a nice area. Don't really have to travel far... everything is there- shopping and dining choices. The traffic to and from hotel is bad. Just avoid rush hour traffic. We left the hotel in the morning and returned around 6pm. Didn't catch much traffic at all. With out traffic it is 15 - 20 minutes away from strip going North. The staff was nice except for the Cafe eating area. The waiter we had was very rude. The Italian rest. was really, really good.

Reviews.Title: “Suncoast Hotel mixed review”
Reviews.Author: oogramm
Reviews.Content: The Suncoast Hotel itself was nice. The room we had was a standard king room and very spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were rather industrial (hard). The fitness room was well-maintained and the hotel overall pleasing. The casino was well-ventilated and equipped with all the standard gaming. The breakfast buffet was a bargain for we "mature" folks. The evening buffet was mediocre at best. The desk was verrrry slow in checking in. The biggest disadvantage of the Suncoast is its location out away from the Strip and downtown. It is isolated in a more residential part of northwest Las Vegas. They do try to compensate by making a free shuttle available which ran on time and took guests to the airport or to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but filled with cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: buglet74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Suncoast for 4 nights while attending a conference. The rooms are spacious, the view of the golf course was very nice, the food at the many restaurants was pretty good. The downside for me was the cigarette smoke. I was on a non smoking floor - thank goodness. There is so much smoking in the casino and you have to cut through the casino to get anywhere else in the hotel. The location of the hotel is convenient to several interstates so you can quickly move around Las Vegas. We hiked Red Rock canyon which is only about 5 miles from the hotel. We went to the red rock canyon website and found a guided hike that worked with our schedule. Met a small group and took a beautiful 6 mile hike through the canyon. Free of charge. All in all the hotel is nice the smoke drove me crazy though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: simonkklee
Reviews.Content: If you've done the strip and want something different, then do this. It's a nice hotel located about 10 miles away from the strip. The good thing is driving back from the strip to this hotel there is not that much traffic and you get to find out where some of the other areas of vegas are. There are loads of shopping / eating complexes on the roads of Charleston and Sahara which are far more enjoyable to eat and shop at. So location-wise, if you have a car, this is an excellent place. The hotel is very local and friendly. The dealers are great fun to talk to and check-in is minimal fuss. Loads of free parking but you'll most likely drive to other restaurants nearby for eating. The rooms are quite large too and spacious. Most importantly they were clean. I stayed one night at the Bellagio to see the difference but found that to be smaller and far more expensive. Not impressed at all with that but that's another review.... Pricewise I got something like US$110 per night during the trade show times which is pretty good. If you've got a car, and done the Vegas Strip thing, then this is great value. For sure next January in 2008 I will be staying here. Very very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Different Vegas Experiance”
Reviews.Author: SGV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 20 minutes or so from the strip in the area where some of the good golf courses are located.It has a large shopping center across and down the street which has a variety of shops. The hotel itself is not bad ,friendly staff ,service was quick in all departments.Gambling was not profitable for me here but at least there was drink servers coming by the machines every couple minutes which is a rarity on the strip anymore.There is a huge bowling alley there but don't expect to walk in and be able to bowl because they are always busy with leagues,etc.You have to show up a half hour before lanes are available take a number and wait and wait and wait to get a lane.Then you have to deal with bad lane conditions and drunken fools running down the lanes with the ball stuck to their hands and a drink in the other that they are spilling.The bowling pro shop is great for any balls,shoes,etc.There is also a movie theatre and an arcade so Suncoast is very kid friendly. We stayed in a suite with 2 bedrooms which was nice enough but this place has the most uncomfortable beds with the worst linens I have encountered in years.The flat panel tvs on the walls are nice and the room was very clean.Good water pressure and hot water for the bath or showers and plenty of towels. Did not eat in any where other then the buffet it was a decent price and the Friday Seafood night was popular.I never knew people could pile on and eat that many crab legs in one night!There are several other places to eat in the hotel along with a gift shop for snacks.Prices are much cheaper then the strip. Parking is either in the covered garage or the outside lot which was easy enough to get in and out of.Valet of course is also available. If I needed to stay in this part of Vegas again I would stay here if i had to bring my kids they don't make you feel unwelcome like some other hotels.I would not however make this my first choice for an adult trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if you don't mind being away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: clint52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in mid-December, 2006 for a weekend getaway from Los Angeles. Everything was wonderful. Here is a quick rundown from beginning to end: 1) Check-in on a Sat. afternoon was quick and smooth. One issue is that the registration desk is in the heart of the casino. We parked in a side parking lot(closest to the 95 freeway exit) and had to lug our bag thru the whole casino. I did not see any bellman but then again, we didn't look for one either. 2) All employees we had contact with were very polite. When we used the credit card to check-in, they asked for id. Since we were once a victim of identity theft, we appreciate it more these days. 3) The room we had was quite large, 550 square feet. We had a king-bed. The room had a flat screen tv. Note if you bring kids, the channel choices are pretty much limited to news and sports. We had a table, plenty of outlets, a sofa and the bathroom was huge. It has two sinks and the toilet/shower area has a sliding door to separate it. One little nicety for the wife was that the hairdryer located in the room was more powerful than the standard tiny ones most motel chains have. The view was not important to us but we did have a nice one overlooking a golf course and mountains. Overall, the room was clean, spacious, and the weekend rate of $150(163 with tax) may be high for Vegas but I have paid a lot more for the same or less in or out of Vegas. The only negative I can think of was the lighting. There are just a few tiny lamps so don't lose a contact lense!! 4) We ate breakfast and dinner in the coffee shop, Cafe Siena. The food quality was decent though the time between ordering the food and getting it in front of you seemed slow. Service seemed fine and the timing may just have been due to the kitchen since both meals seemed slow in coming but fortunately, the food was still hot! 5) As my wife plays just slots and I spend my time in the race/sports book, the smallish casino suited our needs just fine. If you like to "float" around, this casino may not be the best choice for you. 6) The jacuzzi area was nice and towels are provided. 7) Though I would not say this hotel promotes bringing the kids with you(there are "warning" signs posted to tell you if they see a kid, an adult better be attached to them) , there is a movie theatre, bowling area, and ice cream parlor to keep them occupied. The pool is small so maybe not best if you come in the summer and they want to do a lot of splashing/diving. 8) As has been mentioned in previous reviews, this hotel is about 12+ miles from the heart of the strip. I suggest having a car but the hotel does have a shuttle that takes you to a sister property towards the south part of the strip, The Barbary Coast. There is a Marriott hotel next door with a small casino in it called Rampart if you need a variety. It probably is about a 10 minute walk from door-to-door. 9)Check out at the desk was a breeze. You do have the option of checking out via the tv. We enjoyed our stay here and my thoughts are if you don't need the strip or don't mind driving, can accept paying more than Circus Circus rates, and want a good-sized, quiet room, give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andi0527
Reviews.Content: My daughter had a swim meet in Las Vegas so we stayed at this hotel since it was close to the pool. It is mainly in a residential area and kind of far from the strip. But, it is a nice hotel and if you don't need to be close to the strip it is fine. The rooms are nice and large. The bathroom is nice how it has a separate sink area from the shower for families. The only things I didn't like was the fact that there was no mini frig in the room and that the pillows are horrible. The bed wasn't bad but the pillows are really bad. My head actually hurt from the pillows. I asked the hotel if they had any other pillows and they said that was all they had. I didn't sleep very well for 3 nights since the pillows were so bad. I would highly recommend bringing your own pillow. I learned my lesson for next time. The hotel has a nice movie theater which was nice for my daughters to get together with their friends in the afternoon. It has a nice bowling alley which we didn't use. We went to the buffet once and it was okay. It wasn't bad for a buffet but nothing I would die for. We went to the Seattle's best coffee stop that they had in the lobby every morning which was convenient. We also went to the bagel deli place once which was alright.. Overall, it was a decent hotel that wasn't bad for what we needed. If you need to be in that area of Las Vegas it isn't a bad choice. It is in a nice area of town and there are a lot of restaurants and places to shop close by.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: ssll
Reviews.Content: stayed here in aug 06. not a bad hotel. has all of the basic neccesities. basic room was also nice esp the flat screen. casino average. food below average (go elsewhere). not too far from the strip. overall pleasant stay. i would go back if value was the primary objective.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlyprr
Reviews.Content: It was a little bit farther away than what some of the reviews made out, some said 20 min. I don't think so, unless you drive 100 miles per hour and know exactly where you are going. The shuttle took around 30-40 minutes. Other than that it was very nice. Make sure when you pull in that you go to the lobby, valet service, do not park yourself, we did and ended up dragging our luggage everywhere, until we decided to get back into the van, and park at the east side and still had to drag a little bit. The casino is pretty big, and pretty popular for being so far away from the others. I didn't think the smoke was so bad, I am a non-smoker and it did not bother me that much. The buffet was pretty big, several different stations of food (mexican, seafood, mongolian, chinese, american and italian and a huge desert station) tried some things i have never had before. The flavor of the food average, some even a little bland. We ate there only once. The second place we ate at was the Cafe Sienna and the food is great and they have large portions with fair prices. This is the restaraunt that also does room service. Having kids with us this is the only restaraunt that we ate at. And finally the rooms are huge and beautiful, make sure you get the view with the mountains and golf courses, you also can look down at the pool (which was never busy). Bathrooms were huge, seperate room for the toilet and tub. Double sink in the counter room. And a huge 37 inch tv in your living area, you can order movies for 11.00, we didn't though. You have your bowling, arcade and movie theatre if bored with the casino. Bowling prices were fair, and on Wednesdays they had 1.00 draft beer specials. This is a very clean casino, everywhere you look the employees were cleaning up. Payouts on the machines were ok, my mother did alright, won over 1000.00, and one night i heard alot of yelling and screaming over by the tables, someone was having a lucky night. **Negatives: The casino was freezing, I felt sorry for the cocktail waitresses they have very skimpy outifts. If you want cab service you have to make arrangements 24 hours in advance,(we found out the hard way and was late for the mystere show by 20 minutes). It is a bit far away, but after being 1 day on the strip who cares. Hope you have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hello_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast during Labor Day weekend. The place is about 20 minutes from the Strip, but it was fine because we had a rental car. The place was sold out all weekend, so although I had requested a non-smoking room, by the time I checked in on Saturday, they only had smoking rooms left. Let me say, if you are not a smoker, being in a smoking room is really difficult! I know I'm in Vegas and all, but it doesn't mean I need to be around smoke in my own room! Well, they were able to switch us to a non-smoking room the next day which was great. The hotel is nice, nothing spectacular, but it's clean and it has all the amentities you would want (pool, restaurants, casino, covered free parking). We had breakfast at Cafe Sienna. The food was good and our waitress, Pearl, was a doll! She's a local, so she gave us all these tips around driving around the Strip. We also had breakfast one morning at the Bagel Express which was good as well. Prices at all these places are reasonable. The room was very spacious and it had 37" flat screen tv. My husband loved that.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ute_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suncoast on our way back from a California trip. We got a very nice rate for the Sunday before Labor Day, especially considering holiday hotel rates in Las Vegas. We'd stayed at the Orleans before, which is owned by the same hotel group, and chose this hotel based on the great stay that we'd experienced at the Orleans. Check-in went quite smoothly, without a long wait at the reception desk. We went to our assigned room, but instead of having the 2 beds we'd requested, there was only a king bed and sofa, which didn't work for our party of 3. We called the front desk, and they switched us to a different room with 2 beds. The rooms are very large, with a nice flat panel TV that my husband and grown son loved. The beds are comfortable, but their linens and pillows could use updating. We liked the way the bathrooms are arranged, with 2 sinks outside the toilet/shower area, which made it convenience with 3 of us trying to shower and get ready in the morning. Our room was non-smoking, and the entire floor is also non-smoking, which helps to eliminate any smoke smell. We did go bowling. The bowling area is large, with 64 lanes, and it's nice to have something to do that isn't gambling associated. As other travelers have mentioned, it's extremely smokey in the casino area. We didn't spend any time there, but it was annoying even walking through. My main complaint about the hotel is the way it's laid out. You have to parade through the casino with your luggage. It would be nice if there was a separate entrance for hotel guests that bypassed the casino. We will definitely be staying at the Coast hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip? Fine by me!”
Reviews.Author: MissIndecisive
Reviews.Content: We don't do the normal Vegas thing so staying all the way out in Summerlin wasn't a problem -we tend to go for the climbing at Red Rocks so this was a near perfect location. Loved the Cafe Siena's "Graveyard Specials" from midnight to 9am Monday thru Friday (I think it was Monday) breakfast for an amazing $1.95. Not brillant food but edible. We really didn't eat at the hotel too much - just breakfast which was either from the Seatles' Best stand or the bagel place. The guy on the front desk talked us out of a golf course view - for non-smoking he only had 3rd floor available - it would be over the pool, near some construction and we would hear all the delivery trucks - so we were super pleased with the 9th floor non-golf course view. This view is of two huge condo towers being built - but they were far enough away we never heard them -plus it was Memorial Day weekend so we only saw them working on Friday and Tuesday. Room was bigger than I expected - as was the bathroom. If I had one thing I didn't care for it was that the room and bathroom were a little bit dark. I love the bathroom at Paris - but was willing to give that up in exchange for not hearing my next door neighbors' every word (those thin walls at Paris bug me!). All and all I'd stay here again = but I'd really love to go to the new Red Rocks Palace Station next!

Reviews.Title: “good stay- lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Suncoast for a week while working in las vegas. The hotel had lots of amenities, many restaurants, would be great for family (it has a movie theater and bowling alley inside). Rooms were large, not the most luxurious, but nice and clean. Also adjacent to many golf courses. Would recommend it and would stay there again if ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: BananaH993
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel! We stayed there last summer and it was perfect. It is about 20-25 mins. from the strip, but that was not a problem for us because we had our car. It's kinda small, only about 300 rooms, but that made it easy to get around. The pool is awesome!!! It's not too big...but it was NEVER crowded....and we were there in July when it was 105 degrees out! We got lunch delivered to the pool and the burgers and fries were great...just what we needed. We ate breakfast at the buffet, and at the little cafe there (p.s. the brownies at the cafe are scrumptious and HUGE)...well worth the money. We never ate dinner at the hotel, as we were always out and about on the town. You have to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, it is right across the street in a shopping complex. It's yummy and they really do have the best cheesecake! We ate there 3 times (chicken madeira is my fave!). We saw a movie at a theatre down Rampart Blvd...on the corner of Sahara (my sister used to live in Vegas...I have been there numerous times so I know my way around well), but we did not see a movie at the Suncoast, although we have heard it is nice. We had to go bowling....we did so the last night we were there at 2 AM just to say we went bowling at 2 AM! It was alot of fun....pretty crowded for the middle of a Thursday night! But still plenty of room for everyone. We checked out Studio 54 and OPM (been there numerous times....it is our favorite nightclub). Had a blast. Also ate ate Carrabba's, TGI Fridays, Mandalay Bay Buffet (our fave buffet...on Sunday it's free champagne ALL DAY!), and the Aladdin Buffet...all were very good. I am definately a buffet critic...so I know my stuff! A great trip....for a great price. Will for sure be back to Vegas my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “big room, short on amenities”
Reviews.Author: galinuva
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Suncoast Hotel and Casino after a family trip to UT and AZ national parks. We wanted to be off the strip. We are not gamblers. This hotel HAS: * large rooms. 2 kids and 2 adults did not feel cramped * a large bathroom with sinks separate from the toilet & tub area * double sinks with plenty of space in between * a table and 4 chairs where you can eat breakfast (that you buy on your own from room service or a coffee shop) * really ugly beadspreads and curtains that don't match the carpeting * only one lightswitch controlling the entire bathroom * ZILLIONS of slot machines which greet you on your way in -- it's not even obvious where the registration desk is! * a nice pool and hot tub * a neighborhood where you will find restaurants and stores -- lots of modern mall-type places in the area. We did not eat in the smokey restaurants of the casino * a game room * a bowling alley * a movie theater This hotel DOES NOT HAVE * Do Not Distrub door hangers -- the maid came in TWICE after barely knocking when we were in * a coffemaker in the room * free wireless internet -- it costs about $10 * a refrigerator or a minibar in the room * a smoke-free environment, except in the room * enough pillows * comfortable beds So overall, it is typical for Las Vegas, nothing special. The cigarette smoke downstairs was overwhleming.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet,reasonable”
Reviews.Author: morningsidetravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here specifically to AVOID the strip and are glad we did. The room was large and very clean,the shower had excellent water pressure, we heard no noise from people walking down the hall openig doors etc., and we heard nothing from the casino. Yes, the casino was smokey but what casino isn't? The servers do dress in skimpy outfits, but not any more so than any other casino, and the dealers, wait staff, front desk personnel, and house-keeping were really nice, friendly and helpful. Be sure to ask for a room with a mountain view, it is spectacular. The breakfast buffet is worth the money, the Mexican restaurant is so-so, and the Cafe Sienna is a B to B-(don't get the french fries.) We didn't try Primos, but highly recommend The Steakhouse at Circus Circus. Yes we know the Hotel Circus Circus is a dump but the restaurant is GREAT. Since the weather was cool we didn't use the pool but it was sparkling clean and the workout room was a reasonable size. Overall I would stay here again and liked it as much as The Venetian with half the price tag. (Travel Now WebSite 84.99 per night!) The one thing I didn't like was their shampoo but my husband didn't mind it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: LisaS-6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. New and clean. Rooms spacious. Bathrooms nothing spectacular but clean and nice. Food at Silverado's and at Don Vitto's both excellent. Food at Oyster Bar very good. Attended a conference there where the food served was also above average....esp for conference food. Missed that they didn't have a spa or pool open yet...coming summer 2006. But for the price (79 per night) that was can be overlooked. Took shuttle to strip twice. On time and not a bad ride both times. Took cab from airport to Suncoast and it was less than $ 20 for 2 people....25 with tip. Bowling alley, on site cinema and kids areas all nice and a big plus if travelling with a family. Kids area charged 6 per hour per child. We didn't have our children with us...but did check these areas out and they were great. Our kids would have had a blast. Bell staff very courteous and helpful with dinner recommendations. Front desk staff courteous and efficient. We would return again...especially after spa and pool are complete. This was a great business and couple get away location...but wouldn't hesitate to bring kids next time. Plenty to keep them entertained. There's plenty to do at the Suncoast....and the strip isn't that far away when you want more action.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want to see Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Charlie3446
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel and casino if you don't need a shuttle from the airport or don't want to see the strip. The shuttle from the airport runs at on 2 to 4 hour interval. If you in after 11am the next shuttle is not until 3pm. A taxi is about $50. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the strip in traffic and the shuttles to the strip are not very convenient either. The casino is veryu smoky and you have to go through it to get to the rooms. The rooms are very large and nice and I would consider them above average to excellent. If not for the terrible shuttle service I would have rated this hotel much higher. If you don't want to leave or have a vehicle this would be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jmk171
Reviews.Content: Though FAR off the strip, this hotel was nicely sized (you didn't get lost), clean and fairly new. It has a bowling alley and Bingo which begins on the odd hours. The 2 for 1 ice cream sundae's are HUGE so don't go unless you're up for a challenge. $2.00 craps was fun but the table was cold every time I played. Dealers mostly knew what they were doing but they didn't come across as overly friendly. Rooms are also HUGE as are the bathrooms. Nicely tiled floors, double sink area is separate from toilet and tub. If I wanted a casino experience without "The Strip" feel, I would check out the Suncoast again. Oh, and because it's in a suburban neighborhood, there are many local restaurants, shops and even grocery stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This place smells!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there in July of 2005 for a conference, and would not have bothered to write this review except that I saw that others had ranked it so highly. This place is a pit, way to far from the strip and does not even have poker. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my soon to be husband (we got married October 31st in las vegas, loved it. We had no trouble getting the valet parking or the bellhops. The food was great and we had a great view of the mountians. We stayed on the 5th floor. Played the games and loved it. The craps tables started out a $2 mim and the roulett table started out at $.50 mim.

Reviews.Title: “more for your money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martaann
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my room at the Suncoast as I write this reveiw to you, via high speed internet service provided by the hotel at a $9.99 fee. ( a bargin since I probably saved $100 over the 24 hour period, by using my computer instead of gambling!!) Trip advisor is my travelers bible. I was surprised at any negative comments about the Suncoast, but most were positve witch steered me to give it a try. We checked in Monday, Sept. 26 and will depart today Sept. 28. Since it is off season and during the week, we may have not experienced the heavey smoke ,bad service or disgrundled staff some have written about. The rooms are huge, bathrooms gigantic, and the beds are heavenly.(must be a coast hotel trait, Barbary coast has same beds) We booked through trip reservations , paid $44 a night, received a coupon book upon arrival that had a free luch buffet and other offers. The buffet was wonderful. We have stayed on the strip, done all the fancy dancy hotels and wanted to try someplace the locals recommended that had all the amenities we wanted for a decent price. We found it right here. This is video poker heaven! We ordered the "American Casino Guide"off the internet which was filled with valuable gambling information and 2 for one coupons for rooms and food, and gamming. We used Suncoast coupons, and had a fabulous dinner buffet (Tues Filet Mingion ,Prime Rib Seafood etc) , 2 for 1 , saved $15., at the Rampart nex door. We are going to use a coupon and stay at the Las Vegas Club downtown on fremont street when we leave here. $49 for both nights or $59 for newer tower rooms. Another valuable sight is "Cheapo Las vegas" , which will critic everything down to the buffets in Vegas. Along with Trip Advisor, and American Casino guide ,our trip is just costing us mostly gambling expense. We are looking forward to trying the other Coast hotels because our experiences so far have been positive. So to some it up, if you want to get away from the strip, want a great place to stay, want to take in a movie (18 screen movie theater), comfy beds, decent price, high speed internet, perfect size workout room, great air conditioning, good food at great prices and on and on this is the place for you! Hope you have as much fun as we have had!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel not so far of Strip Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: masterchief8a
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with an amazing big rooms and cheap prices, all of their with an espectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE SUNCOAST”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: we stayed august 23-26 myself, husband and 16 yr son upon arrival we switched to a 2 room suite WOW big glass windows, 2 seperate bedrooms each with master bathrooms one room king bed and marble the other 2 doubles and tile. Big picture windows facing golf course, pool and mountains. Large living room two couches, dining table tv each room and bathroom. AAA 229.00 PER NIGHT. Hotel very clean and not too noisy at all they have a bowling alley, movie theater and arcade on thursdays they have pool parties over 21 we never heard noise. We ate at the coffee shop good breakfast nice service , they also have other restaurants and snack places. Lots of places right down the road to eat also KONA GRILL GREAT there is also a chilis, mac grill and lots of fast food there is a mall across the way. Lastly the strip is 15-20 away if you take the freeway which is close and easy 95-to the 15 don't take Charleston too many lights. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Never felt so deceived by reviews”
Reviews.Author: Ivebeenar0und
Reviews.Content: I am not writing to complain. I am writing to warn off trusting readers from believing these raving reviews for Suncoast. I have used Trip Advisor for years; I swear by it, and travel no where without consulting it. But I now feel, in retrospect, utterly deceived by these rave reviews for the Suncoast resort. On the strength of them, I booked us in for our wedding anniversary. Ouch! The litany of our woes began: no one came to help us with our bags when we first drove up. Our $240 a night room was very ordinary. (For example, no in-room safe -- a staple in every hotel i've ever stayed at). Dinner service at Primo's was bad, bad, bad; and took forever for us to be waited on, despite a half-empty restaurant; food was tasteless. Slot machines give paper tickets, no coins drop when you win (a trend in Las Vegas I wasn't aware of). Since there was no in-room safe; the next morning I tried to leave my laptop with personnel inside the security cage; they said they had no boxes to rent, nor could they take responsibility for the computer; as I am writing a book and the laptop had files on it I couldn't afford to have anyone read or steal, I was left to lug it around the Strip all day. Incidentally, it took a far longer time to get downtown from the Summerlin area to the Strip, than the reviews said. Decided I'd had enough. went on the Internet to Trip Advisor, learned the Venetian resort had a king luxury suite with sunken living room at $169 a night, or $70 less than the Suncoast. Booked it. Checked out of Suncoast at 7 p.m. and into the Venetian. Three bellmen surrounded our car when we drove up to the Venetian; whisked our bags inside. Gorgeous classical music playing. Breath-taking decor and art along the walk between registration desk and the main hotel. Our room was stunning; beautiful antiques and classy decorations - - and Vivaldi!! In-room safe that easily stored my lap-top. Helpful concierge that stayed on the phone 15 minutes gettting us tickets to a late night show (Jubilee!). Slots produced coins dropping into the tray whenever you won. Just like the old days. (I'm into nostalgia, especially on a fantastic anniversary!) Heaven! I'll go back to the Venetian in a minute. Every resort will appeal to some people. I know there is a (heavy) market for the Suncoast - - to the dismay of the near-by Marriott's. The $52 a night rooms appeal to families, and the gambling tables are inexpensive. I just think that the visitor weighing whether to stay there or not, needs to be told (as I have attempted here) that the overwhelming ''raves" here for the Suncoast are deceiving. It is a clean, inexpensive large hotel, way out of town. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a very good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: $52/night (weekdays), fairly large rooms, nice golf course/mountain view (be sure to ask for it upon check-in), very nice bathrooms with dual sinks/marble counters/large "earth"-tiled side walls/strong water power, free breakfast buffet every morning (given free vouchers upon check-in). Cons: 3rd night stay could smell smoke coming through A/C vents, tap water not very good tasting, bath towels VERY full of loose LINT, "Therapeutic Thursday" pool party VERY loud until 10:30pm (baby crying through the night). Overall this hotel is very good and should get the high marks most people give it. Also, it is close to some nice shopping and restaurants (e.g., Cheesecake Factory, ClaimJumper, Chilis, Roy's Hawaiian Fusion, etc.). We drove out to Red Rock Canyon for some calm and quiet and it was beautiful, and only a 15 minute drive from the hotel. The strip is about a 20-25 minute drive. Would we stay again? Probably not but will be open to trying the new SouthCoast Hotel when it opens in early 2006. This hotel is just south of the strip and closer for us Los Angeles folks. At day's end, I do recommend this hotel but with some reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sam66Uk
Reviews.Content: Good value if you want an off strip hotel, if you are not sure where to stay then go for somewhere a bit more central. Room was spacious, clean and nice but did not have particularly good views and was also a bit noisy due to some large air con units being located nearby. Buffet was good value for money and the food was good too. Cocktails at the casino bars were poor. Service was very good, probably the best I have experienced anywhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: matwags
Reviews.Content: Pros- We paid $52 for a night which included free buffet breakfast. The room was large, clean and very upscale. The pool, work out facility and hot tub were great. The property is way off the strip with a backdrop of the mountains. There is a high end mall very close, which has a good restaraunt called the Kona Grill. It is close to major roadways. The property includes golf, bowling alleys and a movie theater. Cons- You have to walk through a casino to do go anywhere, including register at the hotel or go to breakfast. There is a ton of smoke in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, large, clean rooms with ***cold*** air conditioning (you'll want that in the desert!), staff extremely friendly and helpful, absolutely wonderful restaurants, casino extremely clean (don't know how they do it, it never closes, of course) just like the rest of the hotel. We had a room on the casino side and although you can see the (clean) roof of the casino, you also have a million dollar view of Las Vegas, especially at night when the city sparkles. No request was too much for any of the staff in any department. I've never seen such clean rooms. The decor is tasteful and modern. Perhaps best of all, it's NOT on The Strip. We visited a few casinos on The Strip and let me tell you I was glad we were staying at Suncoast. It felt like coming home when we returned to our room. We were sorry to have to leave but will definitely come back. Be sure to get the Club Card for the slots. Even with a little playing the points add up fast and we used them to get a great free meal. We ate almost all meals at Suncoast and they were all delicious. Don't miss the rasberry iced tea, it's the best in the world. We don't have children but there are services dedicated to them as well. They won't feel left out. Explore the property. It's large (how they fit a 64-lane state of the art bowling alley on the 2nd floor and made it so quiet you wouldn't know it's there, I don't know), but it's not ridiculously large and irritating like so many hotels on The Strip. We can't wait to go back next year. THANK YOU, SUNCOAST!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After weighing out the comments, I decided to go in favor of the good reviews and ignore the bad ones for many reasons. I arrived thurs at the Suncoast and I must say, for $50 I have found the "Golden Goose". Whoever said the Suncoast was too smokey, needs to stay at the Holiday Inn (no casino). I'm not a smoker myself, however I am mature enough to accept that the by-product smoke goes along with the scheme of things. I didn't read anyone complaining about the free drinks or the half naked waitresses passing them out (the true smokescreen). There is a reason they call it "Sin City". Who cares about not getting the "Golf course view", Tiger Woods ain't out there waiving at me. The 550sq ft. room was not only sufficient, it was decorated beautifully; I closed the curtains and enjoyed-That View. Although me and my husband ate bkfst with the free coupons, the buffet is only $5.95, who expects "delicious delicacy" for under $6 anyway? The front desk staff were handing out coupon books and free buffet tickets "Hand over Fist", who cares if it don't taste like your mamma's cooking. I took my kids bowling with the coupons, and we saw the "Fantastic 4" at the theatre (free popcorn coupon). For the "Goldilocks" looking for the cleanest air, the orthopedic mattress, the gorgeous view, and cuisine meals, all at the best price: "Stay at Home". For those of us looking for the best kept secret: try the Suncoast. I want to thank the tripadvisor for being a great tool when it comes to vacation planing. you are also a "Golden Goose".

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: partyofour
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Suncoast in Las Vegas. We usually stay at the JW Marriott which is located right next to the Suncoast but they didn't have rooms available so we thought we'd try the Suncoast. I have to say that we were really impressed all around. The price: We booked online directly through the Suncoast's website. The room rate we got was $59 a night and included breakfast buffet for 2, 2 passes to the pool party, and coupon book with discounts on ice cream, coffe, free popcorn at the movie theatre, bowling, golf coupons and many more. For $59 a night we really wondered about the quality of the room we were going to get. What a surprise! The room: Located on a non-smoking floor, very nice! The rooms are large by Vegas standards. We had a room with 2 double beds - very comfortable by the way , a comfy chair and ottoman, a table with 3 chairs, armoire with TV, and a desk with chair. We were traveling as a family of 4, 2 adults, 2 toddlers. We had plenty of room and never felt cramped. The bathroom is mid sized, with a sliding door that seperates the sink/vanity area from the toilet/shower area. Soaps, shampoos, bath gel, and a hair dryer were availble too. I didn't include an inside picture of the room, if you go to the Suncoast website you'll see exactly what our room looked like, same bedding, decor, etc. It was very nice. The floor to ceiling windows really give the room a nice open feel. We had a great view of the golf course, pool, and the JW from our room. In comparison to the JW rooms, the only difference is that the bathroom is larger. The room itself is actually nicer at the Suncoast and at a 3rd of the price it's a great deal! Service: Excellent - Valets, bell services, room service, pool servers, front desk, security, everyone we came into contact with was exceptionally nice! Food: The prices here for food are excellent, very reasonable! Tried the Mexican restaurant for lunch one day, pretty good food! The bill for 3 adults and 2 toddlers was just over $25 with entrees, and drinks! Prices are great, espcially the lunch specials! We also had ice cream at the ice cream shop, huge sundaes for just $4, got 2 for 1 with the coupon book! Had a few pastries from the coffe place too, very good! Room Service prices are the best i've ever seen. They state that there is a service charge of $2 per person, but we were never charged more than $2 total, even when ordering for a group of 7 down by the pool. Full american breakfast - eggs, bacon, toast, hash browns - $7.95, cereal $2.95, pancakes - 4 of the biggest we've seen, just $4.95. We also had room service by the pool one afternoon - Chicken fingers and fries - enough for 2 to share $8.95, soft drinks $2.00 - and they don't just bring a can or one single cup, they bring a carafe full of soda and ice and a cup for each, you get about 3 full drinks from each. Again, across the way at the JW you'll pay double to triple the price for room service and there is no difference in quality, I think the food at the Suncoast was actually better! Pool: It's not a very big pool, but that's ok because it was never crowded while we were there. One morning we went down at 9am to swim and there were never more than 3 or 4 other people in the pool with us. We stayed down there until 2pm and we're alone half of the time. There's also a seperate jaccuzi up some steps on it's own patio. The first day we arrived the pool was so warm that the kids didn't even want to swim, by the next morning the temp was nice and cool. Casino: SMOKEY!!!! When we initially pulled up to the casino you could smell the smoke as we got out of the car, luckily we either got use to it or the filters started working a little better because it didn't seem so bad by day 2! We don't really gamble, slots here and there, but the casino looked nice, wasn't too crowded, and was a mix of young and old. The resort also has a movie theater, bowling alley, a kids club, and some other restaurants which we didn't try. I would definetly stay here again, my husband and I agreed that the Suncoast is better than the JW in all respects except for the pool (the pool at the JW is fantastic!). Great rooms, good inexpensive food, lots of food choices. The Suncoast is also located near a few shopping centers where you'll find a Cheesecake Factory, Claim Jumper, Mimi's, Chili's, and PF Changs. You'll be about 20-30 minutes to the strip depending on traffic, oh yes there is traffic! It's traffic comporable to LA and Orange County, the freeways are a mess! If anyone tries to get you to use the beltway, ignore them, it's worse than the freeway traffic! I would recommend the Suncoast for families, younger people who aren't party animals, and older folks. If you're a partier this isn't the place for you, you belong on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suncoast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and view of the golf course. A little out of the way but worth the drive. Restaurant had great food and they have a movie theatre at the resort. Good security too! Would definately recommend the Suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: toby04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to golf for three days and had a great time! Our room on the fourth floor overlooked the golf course. We could sit on the couch and look thru the "wall of windows" and watch the golfers. The bed was great. My 6'2 hubby was in love with the shower, had massage and was high. The St tropez buffet was excellent. The Oyster bar was great. Service was great every where. We had just stayed at the Golden Nugget for weekend, this room was bigger and just as nice. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel with quiet comfortable rooms. I inadvertantly left a camera in the room when I checked out at noon and when I phoned to ask about it (before their 3pm check in time) they supposedly went to check the room and I was told the camera was not there. Also, no one else had checked into that room at that time. It would seem they have some dishonest employees.......be careful with your belongings !!!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Suncoast Hotel and Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 9090 Alta Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89145
